Crouching.caption_en:
Crouch to make it harder for enemies to discover you.
Especially effective in tall grass.
Attacking an enemy that hasn't noticed you will cause more damage than usual.

<?keyicon@9?>: <?keyActName@9?>

Guarding.caption_en:
Use an armament in your left hand or both hands to guard against incoming attacks.
Shields are particularly effective for guarding.
Guarding consumes stamina.
If your stamina runs out, your stance will be broken.

<?keyicon@24?>: Guard

Guard Counters.caption_en:
You can perform a counterattack immediately after blocking an enemy attack.
Guard counters make it easy to break an enemy's stance.

<?keyicon@23?> immediately after blocking an attack: Guard Counter

Two-Handing Armaments.caption_en:
Wielding an armament in two hands will increase your effective strength for that armament by 50%.
This eases attribute requirements, and armaments that scale with strength will do more damage. In addition, attacks with that armament are more difficult to repel with shields.

<?keyicon@27?>+<?keyicon@24?>/<?keyicon@22?>: Wield with two hands

Charge and Jump Attacks.caption_en:
Charge attacks and jump attacks are powerful.
Using them makes it easy to break an enemy's stance.
They are also likely to knock mounted enemies off of their mounts.

Hold <?keyicon@23?>: Charge attack
<?keyicon@23?> while jumping: Jump attack

Skill.caption_en:
Armaments have special abilities called skills.
Skills are highly varied, and range from powerful attacks to temporary effects.
Using skills consumes FP.

<?keyicon@25?>: <?keyActName@25?>

Parrying.caption_en:
Shields allow you to use the "Parry" skill to deflect enemies' close-range attacks.
A successful parry will break the attacker's stance, giving you a chance to perform a critical hit.

<?keyicon@25?> in time with an enemy attack: Parry

Setting a Target.caption_en:
Lock-on to an enemy to keep it targeted, making it easier to focus on it as you fight.

<?keyicon@15?>: <?keyActName@15?>
<?keyControlCamera?> while locked-on to a target: Change target

Precision Aiming.caption_en:
When wielding a bow with two hands, you can hold <?keyicon@24?> for precision aiming.
This lets you aim more precisely with <?keyControlCamera?>.
You can do major damage to foes of human or similar build by aiming for their heads.

<?keyicon@24?> while wielding a bow with two hands: Precision aiming

Equipping Armaments.caption_en:
You can equip up to three armaments each to your left and right hands.

Some armaments, such as shields, have different actions depending on which hand equips them.

Using Items.caption_en:
You can equip up to ten items at a time.
Equipped items can be used without accessing the item menu.
You can also assign items to your pouch to use them directly from the main menu.

<?keyicon@18?>: <?keyActName@18?>
<?keyicon@26?>: <?keyActName@26?>

Using Torches.caption_en:
Raise your torch to see further into dark spaces.

<?keyicon@24?> with torch equipped in left hand: Raise torch

Critical Hits.caption_en:
If you get behind an enemy, you'll have a chance to perform a critical hit.
You can also perform a critical hit after breaking an enemy's stance.
Stance-break critical hits cause more damage than critical hits from behind.

<?keyicon@22?> when near a backturned enemy: Critical hit
<?keyicon@22?> when near a stance-broken enemy: Critical hit

Gestures.caption_en: Use "Gestures" from the main menu to perform a variety of basic poses.

The Map.caption_en:
Use your map to check your current position, as well as the terrain and surrounding structures.
You can update your map with new information by finding map fragments at steles along the road.

<?keyicon@29?>: <?keyActName@29?>

Spiritspring Jumping.caption_en:
Jump while on horseback near a spiritspring to ride its current high into the air.
You won't take damage from jumping into a spiritspring while on horseback, even from a great height.

<?keyicon@8?> at a spiritspring while on horseback: Spiritspring jump

Item Shortcut.caption_en:
When you have multiple items equipped, you can hold <?keyicon@18?> to quickly select the item in your first item slot.

Hold <?keyicon@18?>: Select first equipped item

Dying and Dropping Runes.caption_en:
Upon dying, you will drop any runes in your possession at the site of your death.
You can reclaim those runes by reaching that same spot again.
However, if you die again before reclaiming those dropped runes, they will be lost forever.

Summoning Spirits.caption_en:
When the monument icon is shown on the left side of the screen, you can summon spirits from ashes.
There are several different types of spirits that can be summoned.
Summoning spirits typically consumes FP.

Resting at Sites of Grace.caption_en:
Resting at a site of grace will restore your HP, FP, and cleanse any status ailments.
It will also refill your sacred flasks.

However, most of the enemies you've defeated will be revived.

Finding Sites of Grace.caption_en:
Sites of grace that you haven't discovered yet illuminate their surroundings.
If you see light while exploring, seek it out—you might find a site of grace.

Guidance of Grace.caption_en:
Grace exists to guide the Tarnished and lead them along the proper path.
Even now, some sites of grace retain that power.
Their golden rays will guide you along your way.

Sacred Flasks.caption_en:
The Flask of Crimson Tears replenishes your HP.
The Flask of Cerulean Tears replenishes your FP.

At sites of grace, you can allocate portions of doses to each flask.
You can also use certain items to upgrade your flasks at sites of grace.

Fast Travel to Sites of Grace.caption_en:
Through your map, you can instantly travel to any sites of grace that you've discovered.
However, there are some dungeons and other areas where this cannot be done.

Mounted Attacks.caption_en:
While on horseback, you can attack with armaments equipped in your right hand or in both hands.
If you take a certain amount of damage while on horseback, you will fall from your horse.
This will leave you greatly vulnerable.

No-Riding Areas.caption_en:
You cannot enter large buildings, caves, catacombs, or similar spaces while on horseback.
You also cannot summon your horse while inside such spaces.

Item Crafting.caption_en:
If you have a Crafting Kit, you can make various items from materials that you find.
Select "Item Crafting" from the main menu to make items.

<?keyicon@28?>: <?keyActName@28?>

Container Items.caption_en:
You will need cracked pots or other containers to craft certain items.
Container items will run out with use, but the containers themselves will remain.

Armament Customization.caption_en:
Ashes of War are memories of the affinities and skills imbued in armaments wielded long ago.
With a Whetstone Knife, you can use Ashes of War to customize your armaments at sites of grace.

Reviving After Dying.caption_en:
Upon dying, you will be revived at the last site of grace that you visited.

However, if there is a Stake of Marika near where you died, you can choose to be revived there instead.

Equip Load.caption_en:
When you carry more than 70% of your maximum equipment load, your dodge rolling will become slower and clumsier.
If you exceed your maximum equipment load entirely, you will be unable to roll at all.

While in Combat.caption_en: While in combat, you are unable to craft items or open your map.

Strengthening Spirits.caption_en:
Spirits that you've summoned from ashes can be made more powerful by a spirit tuner.
You'll need glovewort to upgrade spirits.

Leveling Up.caption_en:
When you level up, you can spend runes to increase your attributes.
As your attributes increase, your level rises—and so does the amount of runes required for your next attribute increase.

Status: Poison.caption_en:
When the poison gauge is full, you will become poisoned and take continuous damage.
The higher your immunity, the longer it takes for the poison gauge to fill.

Status: Scarlet Rot.caption_en:
When the scarlet rot gauge is full, you will become sick and take continuous damage.
The scarlet rot is a very dangerous status ailment, but the higher your immunity, the longer it takes for the gauge to fill.

Status: Blood Loss.caption_en:
When the blood loss gauge is full, you will hemorrhage blood.
This causes a large amount of damage relative to your maximum HP.
The higher your robustness, the longer it takes for the blood loss gauge to fill.

Status: Frost/Frostbite.caption_en:
When the frost gauge is full, you will take damage and become frostbitten for a while.
While suffering from frostbite, you will take increased damage from other sources.
The higher your robustness, the longer it takes for the frost gauge to fill.

Status: Sleep.caption_en:
When the sleep gauge is full, you will become drowsy.
Weaker characters will fall asleep entirely.
The higher your focus, the longer it takes for the sleep gauge to fill.

Status: Madness.caption_en:
When the madness gauge is full, you will go mad and lose a great deal of both HP and FP.
Only humans can be afflicted with madness.
The higher your focus, the longer it takes for the madness gauge to fill.

Status: Death.caption_en:
When your death gauge is full, you will be struck with instant death.
This is a very dangerous status ailment, but the higher your resistance to death, the longer it takes for the death gauge to fill.

Poise.caption_en:
Heavy armor provides high poise, making you less likely to recoil from enemy attacks.
Wielding a heavy weapon with two hands may also provide similar effects.

Cooperator's Objective (Furled Finger).caption_en:
During cooperative multiplayer, a Furled Finger's objective is to help the Host of Fingers defeat the boss of the area.
A Furled Finger will return to their own world when they die or the boss is defeated, whichever happens first.

Adversary's Objective (Duelist).caption_en:
During competitive multiplayer, a duelist's objective is to defeat the Host of Fingers.
A duelist will return to their own world when they die or the Host of Fingers is defeated, whichever happens first.

Multiplayer Maximums.caption_en:
In typical multiplayer, there can be up to two cooperators and one invader or adversary present at once.

The host player can use a Taunter's Tongue to increase the maximum number of invaders or adversaries.

Seeing Summon Signs.caption_en:
With a Furlcalling Finger Remedy, you can see summon signs left by players in other worlds.

If you summon another player through their sign, multiplayer will begin, with you as the Host of Fingers.

Leaving Co-op Signs.caption_en:
With a Tarnished's Furled Finger, you can leave a gold summon sign.
This sign will appear in other players' worlds and allow them to summon you as a Furled Finger for cooperative multiplayer.

Leaving Hostile Signs.caption_en:
With a Duelist's Furled Finger, you can leave a red summon sign.
This sign will appear in other players' worlds and allow them to summon you as a duelist adversary for competitive multiplayer.

Invasion.caption_en:
With a Festering Bloody Finger, you can enter another player's world as an invading Bloody Finger.
There are other items that allow you to invade other worlds as well.

Requesting Support.caption_en:
If you use a White Cipher Ring, you will automatically request for a hunter from another world to come to your rescue when your world is invaded.
(Summoning is not always possible.)

Supporting.caption_en: If you use a Blue Cipher Ring, you will make yourself open to summons for rescue from other worlds. You will be summoned to their world as a hunter.

Summoning Pools.caption_en:
In each area, you may find effigies of martyrs.
These effigies are summoning pools.

Summon signs made with small effigies are gathered at these summoning pools.
You'll find it easy to summon other players at these locations.

Group Passwords.caption_en: If you set a group password, you'll be more likely to see messages, summon signs, bloodstains, and phantoms from other players using the same password.

Multiplayer Passwords.caption_en:
If you set a multiplayer password, you'll only be matched with other players using the same password for most multiplayer features.

However, multiplayer passwords do not apply to invasion multiplayer.

Messages.caption_en:
You can use the Messages menu to leave messages for other players.

Your message will appear in other players' worlds at the spot where you stood when you wrote it.

Multiplayer Movement Limits.caption_en:
During multiplayer, you can only explore a limited area.
Areas beyond those limits are blocked off with a wall of light.
They will be accessible again after multiplayer ends.

Phantoms.caption_en:
You may occasionally see faint, white phantoms.
These are traces of players in other worlds and the actions they recently performed.

Bloodstains.caption_en:
Bloodstains are left behind in spots where players in other worlds have died.
You can examine them to see how those players died.

Support Objective (Hunter).caption_en:
During supportive multiplayer, a hunter's objective is to defeat an invader.
A hunter will return to their own world when they die or the invader is defeated, whichever happens first.

Summon Signs.caption_en:
There are two types of summon signs left by players in other worlds.

Gold signs will summon Furled Finger cooperators.
Red signs will summon duelist adversaries.

Advanced Messages.caption_en:
You can change the message format to leave more complex messages.
You can also attach gestures to your messages.

<?keyicon@30?>: Change message format

Invader Objective.caption_en:
During invasion multiplayer, the invader's objective is to defeat the Host of Fingers.
An invader will return to their own world when they die or the Host of Fingers is defeated, whichever happens first.

Limits of Guarding.caption_en:
Attacks with certain affinities, such as fire or lightning, may make guarding less effective than it is against normal physical attacks.

Guarding does not work against many grappling attacks.

Stance-Breaking.caption_en:
Some attacks may break an enemy's stance, giving you a chance to perform a critical hit.
Charge attacks and jump attacks make it particularly easy to break an enemy's stance.

Knocking Down Mounted Enemies.caption_en:
Repeatedly attack a mounted enemy to knock them off of their mount and break their stance.
This will give you a chance to perform a critical hit.
Charge attacks and jump attacks are particularly likely to knock enemies off of their mounts.

Hardened Foes.caption_en: The slashing attacks of sharp weapons are largely ineffective against hardened armor and scales. Strike attacks are likely to hit the mark.

Teardrop Scarabs.caption_en:
There are both Crimson and Cerulean Teardrop Scarabs.
Defeat them to replenish the flasks that match their type.
However, you cannot replenish more flasks than your maximum amount allows.

Head.caption_en: Bare head with no armor equipped.

Body.caption_en: Bare torso with no armor equipped.

Arms.caption_en: Bare arms with no armor equipped.

Legs.caption_en: Bare legs with no armor equipped.

Iron Helmet.caption_en:
An iron helmet showing rust on its edges.

Cloth covering the mouth and neck provides some resistance to poison and other irritants.

Scale Armor.info_en: Armor composed of small metal plates
Scale Armor.caption_en:
Armor reinforced with small metal scales.

The cape covering the shoulders is made with treated rock lizard skin, and provides ample protection against fire.

Leather Trousers.caption_en:
Well-made leather trousers.

The lower legs are each bound in cord for ease of movement.

Kaiden Helm.caption_en:
Helm worn by Kaiden sellswords.

These hulking, fearless mercenaries, said to hail from the mountaintops of the wintry north, are adept at fighting on horseback.
Kaiden is the name of their home settlement.

Kaiden Armor.caption_en:
Armor worn by Kaiden sellswords.
Made with the pelt of a snow-wolf, which protects against the cold.

These hulking, fearless mercenaries, said to hail from the mountaintops of the wintry north, are adept at fighting on horseback.
Kaiden is the name of their home settlement.

Kaiden Gauntlets.caption_en:
Gauntlets worn by Kaiden sellswords.

These hulking, fearless mercenaries, said to hail from the mountaintops of the wintry north, are adept at fighting on horseback.
Kaiden is the name of their home settlement.

Kaiden Trousers.caption_en:
Trousers worn by Kaiden sellswords.

These hulking, fearless mercenaries, said to hail from the mountaintops of the wintry north, are adept at fighting on horseback.
Kaiden is the name of their home settlement.

Drake Knight Helm.info_en: Malformed helm fused with dragon flesh
Drake Knight Helm.caption_en:
Black iron helm worn by drake knights.
Features the spoils of a dragon catch as an emblem of pride as both dragon hunter and partaker of communion.

From birth, drake knights speak not a word. They spend their lives pursuing the strength of dragons, for its sublime beauty and inspiration of awe.

Drake Knight Armor.info_en: Malformed armor fused with dragon flesh
Drake Knight Armor.caption_en:
Black iron armor worn by drake knights.
Features the spoils of a dragon catch as an emblem of pride as both dragon hunter and partaker of communion.

The cape is crafted with dragon wing membrane.

Drake Knight Gauntlets.info_en: Malformed gauntlets fused with dragon flesh
Drake Knight Gauntlets.caption_en:
Black iron gauntlets worn by drake knights.
Features the spoils of a dragon catch as an emblem of pride as both dragon hunter and partaker of communion.

From birth, drake knights speak not a word. They spend their lives pursuing the strength of dragons, for its sublime beauty and inspiration of awe.

Scaled Helm.info_en: Helm made from layered ancient dragon scales
Scaled Helm.caption_en:
Helm worn by Old Knight Istvan.
The corroded metal is reinforced with rock-hard scales, making it highly effective against non-physical attacks.

Istvan is one of a few wizened Tarnished who survive to this day.

Scaled Armor.caption_en:
Armor worn by Old Knight Istvan.
The corroded metal is reinforced with rock-hard scales, making it highly effective against non-physical attacks.

Perfumer Hood.info_en: Hood of an Erdtree Capital perfumer
Perfumer Hood.caption_en:
Hood of an Erdtree Capital perfumer.

In times past, the role of perfumer was much respected; a blessed apothecary in the eyes of the many. But after entering the battlefields of the Shattering they performed no such role, trading their aromatics for poisons and explosives.

Perfumer Robe.info_en: Robe of an Erdtree Capital perfumer
Perfumer Robe.caption_en:
Robe of an Erdtree Capital perfumer.

The thick front apron embroidered with a depiction of the Erdtree is proof of mastery of the apothecarial arts, and its weight symbolizes the onus of both pride and responsibility.

Perfumer Gloves.info_en: Gloves of an Erdtree Capital perfumer
Perfumer Gloves.caption_en:
Gloves of an Erdtree Capital perfumer.

In times past, the role of perfumer was much respected; a blessed apothecary in the eyes of the many. But after entering the battlefields of the Shattering they performed no such role, trading their aromatics for poisons and explosives.

Traveler's Hat.info_en: Leather tricorne of an unaffiliated perfumer
Traveler's Hat.caption_en:
Hat of a traveling perfumer of no renown.

An associate of a healer, he is said to be in search of new aromatics and flower gardens, in hopes of treating Misbegotten, Omen, and all those seen as impure.

Perfumer's Traveling Garb.caption_en:
Garb of a traveling perfumer of no renown.

The thick front apron, the badge of a perfumer, has been replaced with a more simple one made from soft leather.

Traveler's Gloves.caption_en:
Gloves of a traveling perfumer of no renown.

An associate of a healer, he is said to be in search of new aromatics and flower gardens, in hopes of treating Misbegotten, Omen, and all those seen as impure.

Traveler's Slops.caption_en:
Slops of a traveling perfumer of no renown.

An associate of a healer, he is said to be in search of new aromatics and flower gardens, in hopes of treating Misbegotten, Omen, and all those seen as impure.

Perfumer's Traveling Garb (Altered).caption_en:
Garb of a traveling perfumer of no renown.

The thick front apron, the badge of a perfumer, has been replaced with a more simple one made from soft leather.

Alberich's Pointed Hat.info_en: Hat of a defected glintstone sorcerer
Alberich's Pointed Hat.caption_en:
Mad Tongue Alberich's pointed hat, a sign of a heretical practitioner.

Set with red glintstones, said to be formed by the blood of sacrifices. Strengthens thorn sorcery.

Alberich was an aloof yet disturbed heretical sorcerer said to have been driven mad by jeering tongues during his service to the Roundtable Hold long ago.

Alberich's Robe.info_en: Robe of a defected glintstone sorcerer
Alberich's Robe.caption_en:
Mad Tongue Alberich's robe.

Set with red glintstones, said to be formed by the blood of sacrifices. Strengthens thorn sorcery.

Alberich was an aloof yet disturbed heretical sorcerer said to have been driven mad by jeering tongues during his service to the Roundtable Hold long ago.

Spellblade's Pointed Hat.caption_en:
Glintstone sorcerer Rogier's pointed hat, a sign of a heretical practitioner. Strengthens glintstone sorcery skills.

Rogier spent his entire life behaving with utter detachment. No one noticed the anger, grief, regret, or fear that existed along with it.

Spellblade's Traveling Attire.caption_en:
Glintstone sorcerer Rogier's traveling attire, graced with an intricate, aristocratic decoration. Strengthens glintstone sorcery skills.

Rogier spent his entire life behaving with utter detachment. No one noticed the anger, grief, regret, or fear that existed along with it.

Bull-Goat Helm.caption_en:
Great Horned Tragoth's helm, adorned with a gold bull-goat motif. Provides high poise.

Tragoth is a famed knight of assistance. Countless Tarnished, facing adversity in the Lands Between, have survived thanks only to the Great Horned One's aid.

Bull-Goat Armor.caption_en:
Great Horned Tragoth's armor. Covers its wearer with a pair of giant horns, providing staunch poise.

Tragoth is a famed knight of assistance. Countless Tarnished, facing adversity in the Lands Between, have survived thanks only to the Great Horned One's aid.

Bull-Goat Gauntlets.caption_en:
Great Horned Tragoth's gauntlets, adorned with a gold bull-goat motif. Provide high poise.

Tragoth is a famed knight of assistance. Countless Tarnished, facing adversity in the Lands Between, have survived thanks only to the Great Horned One's aid.

Tragoth is a famed knight of assistance. Countless Tarnished, facing adversity in the Lands Between, have survived thanks only to the Great Horned One's aid.

Iron Kasa.caption_en:
Iron kasa of the man who calls himself Shabriri.
Crafted to imitate the woven straw hats worn in the Land of Reeds.

The man, once known as Yura, kept a woman in the deepest reaches of his heart.

Ronin's Armor.caption_en:
Armor of the man who calls himself Shabriri.
Highly functional and heavily worn.

The man, once known as Yura, kept a woman in the deepest reaches of his heart.

Ronin's Gauntlets.caption_en:
Gauntlets of the man who calls himself Shabriri.
Highly functional and heavily worn.

The man, once known as Yura, kept a woman in the deepest reaches of his heart.

Guilty Hood.info_en: Coarse hooded cloak of olive brown
Guilty Hood.caption_en:
Coarse hooded cloak of olive brown.

The garb of those accused of lesser crimes, indicated by the collar of sharpened branches.

Cloth Garb.caption_en: Clothing made of coarse material, commonly worn in the Lands Between.

Tarnished Wrap.info_en: Arm wraps made of rough material
Tarnished Wrap.caption_en:
Arm wraps made of coarse material.
Garb of spurned Tarnished who were
forced into slavery in the Lands Between.

Cloth Trousers.caption_en: Trousers made of coarse material, commonly worn in the Lands Between.

Black Wolf Mask.info_en: Helm made with the head of an old wolf
Black Wolf Mask.caption_en:
A mask fashioned after the head of a black wolf.

Relic of an assassin who assumed the guise of Ranni the Witch's loyal shadow. The likeness is striking.

Blaidd's Armor.info_en: Armor of Blaidd, Knight of Ranni
Blaidd's Armor.caption_en:
Well-worn black armor of the man-wolf Blaidd.

The pelt serves as a cape, protecting from cold.
Blaidd was the blade of Ranni, but the cold bothered him anyway.

Blaidd's Gauntlets.info_en: Gauntlets of Blaidd, Knight of Ranni
Blaidd's Gauntlets.caption_en:
Well-worn black gauntlets of the man-wolf Blaidd.

Blaidd, who served as Ranni's shadow, was a loyal ally who would defy destiny itself if it would have him turn upon his Lady.

Blaidd's Greaves.info_en: Greaves of Blaidd, Knight of Ranni
Blaidd's Greaves.caption_en:
Well-worn black greaves of the man-wolf Blaidd.

Blaidd, who served as Ranni's shadow, was a loyal ally who would defy destiny itself if it would have him turn upon his Lady.

Blaidd's Armor (Altered).info_en: Armor of Blaidd, Knight of Ranni
Blaidd's Armor (Altered).caption_en:
Well-worn black armor of the man-wolf Blaidd.

Blaidd, who served as Ranni's shadow, was a loyal ally who would defy destiny itself if it would have him turn upon his Lady.

Black Knife Hood.info_en: Hood used by the Black Blade Assassins
Black Knife Hood.caption_en:
Hood used by the Black Knife Assassins.

The assassins that carried out the deeds of the Night of the Black Knives were all women, and rumored to be Numen who had close ties with Marika herself.

Black Knife Armor.info_en: Armor used by the Black Blade Assassins
Black Knife Armor.caption_en:
Scale armor used by the Black Knife Assassins, forged to make no sound.

Traces of power yet remain in its concealing veil, which muffles the sound of footsteps.

The assassins that carried out the deeds of the Night of the Black Knives were all women, and rumored to be Numen who had close ties with Marika herself.

Black Knife Gauntlets.info_en: Gauntlets used by the Black Blade Assassins
Black Knife Gauntlets.caption_en:
Gauntlets used by the Black Knife Assassins.
Crafted with scale armor that makes no sound.

The assassins that carried out the deeds of the Night of the Black Knives were all women, and rumored to be Numen who had close ties with Marika herself.

Greaves used by the Black Knife Assassins.

Exile Hood.info_en: Deep red hood that covers the whole head
Exile Hood.caption_en:
Deep red hood that covers the whole head.

Worn by soldiers sent to the penal colonies, who were required to keep their faces hidden.

Exile Armor.info_en: Worn body armor, wrapped in a great cloth
Exile Armor.caption_en:
Damaged armor draped with a large deep-red cloth.
Worn by soldiers sent to the penal colonies.

Exile Gauntlets.info_en: Iron gauntlets worn by salt winds and battle
Exile Gauntlets.caption_en:
Damaged iron gauntlets.
Worn by soldiers sent to the penal colonies.

Exile Greaves.info_en: Iron greaves worn by salt winds and battle
Exile Greaves.caption_en:
Damaged iron greaves.
Worn by soldiers sent to the penal colonies.

Banished Knight Helm.info_en: Knight's helm covered in a long cloth of deep red
Banished Knight Helm.caption_en:
Thick, full set of armor covering the entire body.
This helm was worn by knights who, whether by misfortune or misdeed, were forced to abandon their homes.

Perhaps the deep-red scarf was used to block the winds, for on the outskirts, the winds bite with a stinging fierceness.

Banished Knight Armor.info_en: Knight's armor, worn by salt winds and battle
Banished Knight Armor.caption_en:
Thick, full set of armor covering the entire body.
This armor was worn by knights who, whether by misfortune or misdeed, were forced to abandon their homes.

These fierce warriors were each and all accomplished. Perhaps that is why, despite their territorial losses, they were still named knights.

Banished Knight Gauntlets.info_en: Knight's gauntlets, worn by salt winds and battle
Banished Knight Gauntlets.caption_en:
Thick, full set of armor covering the entire body.
These gauntlets were worn by knights who, whether by misfortune or misdeed, were forced to abandon their homes.

These fierce warriors were each and all accomplished. Perhaps that is why, despite their territorial losses, they were still named knights.

These fierce warriors were each and all accomplished. Perhaps that is why, despite their territorial losses, they were still named knights.

Briar Helm.caption_en:
Battered iron helm from a foreign land.
Worn by Elemer of the Briar.

The winding, rusted iron briars are a mark of the guilty, and typically indicate a sentence of death.
Elemer murdered numerous instructors and merchants, and was known as the Bell Bearing Hunter.

Battered iron armor from a foreign land.
Worn by Elemer of the Briar.

The winding, rusted iron briars are a mark of the guilty, and typically indicate a sentence of death.
Elemer murdered numerous instructors and merchants, and was known as the Bell Bearing Hunter.

Page Hood.caption_en:
Hood worn by pages who serve the nobility and are mindful to keep them out of harm's way.

The unassuming sack-like appearance befits their unseen and unknown stature.

Page Garb.caption_en:
Garb worn by pages who serve the nobility and are mindful to keep them out of harm's way.

Traveling wear tailored with exquisite precision, to avoid any undue shame for the page's master.

Page Trousers.caption_en:
Trousers worn by pages who serve the nobility and are mindful to keep them out of harm's way.

Traveling wear tailored with exquisite precision, to avoid any undue shame for the page's master.

Page Garb (Altered).caption_en:
Garb worn by pages who serve the nobility and are mindful to keep them out of harm's way.

Traveling wear tailored with exquisite precision, to avoid any undue shame for the page's master.

Night's Cavalry Helm.caption_en:
Pitch-black helm with flowing black hair.
Worn by the Night's Cavalry who ride funeral steeds.

The Night's Cavalry, who now wander the dim roads of night, were once led by the Fell Omen and were deliverers of death for great warriors, knights, and champions.

Night's Cavalry Armor.caption_en:
Pitch-black armor thinly painted with dried blood.
Worn by the Night's Cavalry who ride funeral steeds.

The Night's Cavalry, who now wander the dim roads of night, were once led by the Fell Omen and were deliverers of death for great warriors, knights, and champions.

Night's Cavalry Gauntlets.caption_en:
Pitch-black gauntlets thinly painted with dried blood.
Worn by the Night's Cavalry who ride funeral steeds.

The Night's Cavalry, who now wander the dim roads of night, were once led by the Fell Omen and were deliverers of death for great warriors, knights, and champions.

Night's Cavalry Greaves.caption_en:
Pitch-black greaves thinly painted with dried blood.
Worn by the Night's Cavalry who ride funeral steeds.

The Night's Cavalry, who now wander the dim roads of night, were once led by the Fell Omen and were deliverers of death for great warriors, knights, and champions.

Night's Cavalry Helm (Altered).caption_en:
Pitch-black helm thinly painted with dried blood.
Worn by the Night's Cavalry who ride funeral steeds.

Blue Silver Mail Hood.info_en: Chainmail hood made of motherly silver
Blue Silver Mail Hood.caption_en:
Chainmail hood crafted with blue silver.
Worn by the wolf-riding Albinauric archers.

Blue silver is a metal born from the same mother as the archers themselves, and provides protection from magic and frost.

Blue Silver Mail Armor.info_en: Chainmail armor made of motherly silver
Blue Silver Mail Armor.caption_en:
Chainmail armor crafted with blue silver.
Worn by the wolf-riding Albinauric archers.

Blue silver is a metal born from the same mother as the archers themselves, and provides protection from magic and frost.

Blue Silver Bracelets.caption_en:
Bracelets crafted with blue silver.
Worn by the wolf-riding Albinauric archers.

Blue silver is a metal born from the same mother as the archers themselves, and provides protection from magic and frost.

Blue Silver Mail Skirt.info_en: Chainmail skirt made of motherly silver
Blue Silver Mail Skirt.caption_en:
Chainmail skirt crafted with blue silver.
Worn by the wolf-riding Albinauric archers.

Blue silver is a metal born from the same mother as the archers themselves, and provides protection from magic and frost.

Blue Silver Mail Armor (Altered).caption_en:
Chainmail armor crafted with blue silver.
Worn by the wolf-riding Albinauric archers.

Blue silver is a metal born from the same mother as the archers themselves, and provides protection from magic and frost.

Nomadic Merchant's Chapeau.caption_en:
Chapeau of the nomadic merchants.
Decorated with tiny gems in a wide spectrum of colors.

These merchants once thrived as the Great Caravan, but after being accused of heretical beliefs, their entire clan was rounded up and buried alive far underground.

Then, they chanted a curse of despair, and summoned the flame of frenzy.

Nomadic Merchant's Finery.caption_en:
Finery of the nomadic merchants.
Decorated with tiny gems in a wide spectrum of colors.

These merchants once thrived as the Great Caravan, but after being accused of heretical beliefs, their entire clan was rounded up and buried alive far underground.

Then, they chanted a curse of despair, and summoned the flame of frenzy.

Nomadic Merchant's Trousers.caption_en:
Trousers of the nomadic merchants.

These merchants once thrived as the Great Caravan, but after being accused of heretical beliefs, their entire clan was rounded up and buried alive far underground.

Then, they chanted a curse of despair, and summoned the flame of frenzy.

These merchants once thrived as the Great Caravan, but after being accused of heretical beliefs, their entire clan was rounded up and buried alive far underground.

Then, they chanted a curse of despair, and summoned the flame of frenzy.

Malformed Dragon Helm.info_en: Malformed, golden helm used by Gnarrl
Malformed Dragon Helm.caption_en:
A malformed golden helm.
Adorned with various dragon imagery and worn by the misshapen Tree Sentinels.

After the great ancient dragon Gransax attacked, the sentinels had an epiphany. The only way to truly protect the Erdtree was to become dragons themselves.

Malformed Dragon Armor.info_en: Malformed, golden armor used by Gnarrl
Malformed Dragon Armor.caption_en:
Malformed golden armor.
Adorned with various dragon imagery and worn by the misshapen Tree Sentinels.

After the great ancient dragon Gransax attacked, the sentinels had an epiphany. The only way to truly protect the Erdtree was to become dragons themselves.

Malformed Dragon Greaves.caption_en:
Malformed golden greaves.
Adorned with various dragon imagery and worn by the misshapen Tree Sentinels.

After the great ancient dragon Gransax attacked, the sentinels had an epiphany. The only way to truly protect the Erdtree was to become dragons themselves.

Tree Sentinel Helm.caption_en:
Golden helm of the heavy cavalry Tree Sentinels who serve the Erdtree.

Very few are permitted to wear a golden wood crest of such size as seen on this helm.

Tree Sentinel Armor.caption_en:
Golden armor of the heavy cavalry Tree Sentinels who serve the Erdtree.

Adorned with a cape featuring the mark of the sacred tree.

Imposingly sturdy and nigh unbreakable, the grace of old yet lingers.

Tree Sentinel Gauntlets.caption_en:
Golden gauntlets of the heavy cavalry Tree Sentinels who serve the Erdtree.

Imposingly sturdy and nigh unbreakable, the grace of old yet lingers.

Tree Sentinel Greaves.caption_en:
Golden greaves of the heavy cavalry Tree Sentinels who serve the Erdtree.

Imposingly sturdy and nigh unbreakable, the grace of old yet lingers.

Tree Sentinel Armor (Altered).caption_en:
Golden armor of the heavy cavalry Tree Sentinels who serve the Erdtree.

Imposingly sturdy and nigh unbreakable, the grace of old yet lingers.

Royal Knight Helm.caption_en:
Silver helm of Loretta, a knight who served Miquella's Haligtree.

Loretta, once a royal Carian knight, went on a journey in search of a haven for Albinaurics, and determined that the Haligtree was their best chance for eventual salvation.

Royal Knight Armor.caption_en:
Silver armor of Loretta, a knight who served Miquella's Haligtree.

Loretta was once a royal Carian knight, and her lapis-lazuli blue cape is the emblem of the knightly pride that continues to guide her.

Royal Knight Gauntlets.caption_en:
Silver gauntlets of Loretta, a knight who served Miquella's Haligtree.

Loretta, once a royal Carian knight, went on a journey in search of a haven for Albinaurics, and determined that the Haligtree was their best chance for eventual salvation.

Royal Knight Greaves.caption_en:
Silver greaves of Loretta, a knight who served Miquella's Haligtree.

Loretta, once a royal Carian knight, went on a journey in search of a haven for Albinaurics, and determined that the Haligtree was their best chance for eventual salvation.

Royal Knight Armor (Altered).caption_en:
Silver armor of Loretta, a knight who served Miquella's Haligtree.

Loretta, once a royal Carian knight, went on a journey in search of a haven for Albinaurics, and determined that the Haligtree was their best chance for eventual salvation.

Nox Monk Hood.info_en: Hood worn by members of the Empyrean family
Nox Monk Hood.caption_en:
Silk hood worn by the monks of the Eternal City.

Long ago, the Nox invoked the ire of the Greater Will, and were banished deep underground. Now they live under a false night sky, in eternal anticipation of their liege. Of the coming age of the stars. And their Lord of Night.

Nox Monk Armor.info_en: Armor worn by members of the Empyrean family
Nox Monk Armor.caption_en:
Armor worn by the monks of the Eternal City, with a silk cape attached.

Long ago, the Nox invoked the ire of the Greater Will, and were banished deep underground. Now they live under a false night sky, in eternal anticipation of their liege. Of the coming age of the stars. And their Lord of Night.

Nox Monk Bracelets.info_en: Bracelets worn by members of the Empyrean family
Nox Monk Bracelets.caption_en:
Bracelets worn by the monks of the Eternal City.

Long ago, the Nox invoked the ire of the Greater Will, and were banished deep underground. Now they live under a false night sky, in eternal anticipation of their liege. Of the coming age of the stars. And their Lord of Night.

Nox Monk Greaves.info_en: Waistcloth worn by members of the Empyrean family
Nox Monk Greaves.caption_en:
Greaves worn by the monks of the Eternal City.

Nox Swordstress Crown.info_en: Crown worn by members of the Empyrean family
Nox Swordstress Crown.caption_en:
Crown worn by swordstresses of the Eternal City.
These women are the personal guards of the nightmaidens, and the silk hides their eyes.

Long ago, the Nox invoked the ire of the Greater Will, and were banished deep underground. Now they live under a false night sky, in eternal anticipation of their liege. Of the coming age of the stars. And their Lord of Night.

Nox Swordstress Armor.info_en: Robe worn by members of the Empyrean family
Nox Swordstress Armor.caption_en:
Armor worn by swordstresses of the Eternal City.
These women are the personal guards of the nightmaidens, and wear silk capes.

Long ago, the Nox invoked the ire of the Greater Will, and were banished deep underground. Now they live under a false night sky, in eternal anticipation of their liege. Of the coming age of the stars. And their Lord of Night.

Night Maiden Twin Crown.info_en: Crown worn by members of the Empyrean family
Night Maiden Twin Crown.caption_en:
Twin crowns worn by the nightmaidens of the Eternal City.
Indicates the highest clerical rank, and hides the eyes with silk.

Long ago, the Nox invoked the ire of the Greater Will, and were banished deep underground. Now they live under a false night sky, in eternal anticipation of their liege. Of the coming age of the stars. And their Lord of Night.

Night Maiden Armor.info_en: Tunic worn by members of the Empyrean family
Night Maiden Armor.caption_en:
Armor worn by the nightmaidens of the Eternal City.
Indicates the highest clerical rank, and includes a silk cape.

Long ago, the Nox invoked the ire of the Greater Will, and were banished deep underground. Now they live under a false night sky, in eternal anticipation of their liege. Of the coming age of the stars. And their Lord of Night.

Nox Swordstress Crown (Altered).info_en: Crown worn by members of the Empyrean family
Nox Swordstress Crown (Altered).caption_en:
Crown worn by swordstresses of the Eternal City.
The silk eye covering is removed, flaunting convention.

Long ago, the Nox invoked the ire of the Greater Will, and were banished deep underground. Now they live under a false night sky, in eternal anticipation of their liege. Of the coming age of the stars. And their Lord of Night.

Nox Swordstress Armor (Altered).info_en: Tunic worn by members of the Empyrean family
Nox Swordstress Armor (Altered).caption_en:
Armor worn by swordstresses of the Eternal City.
These women are the personal guards of the nightmaidens.

Long ago, the Nox invoked the ire of the Greater Will, and were banished deep underground. Now they live under a false night sky, in eternal anticipation of their liege. Of the coming age of the stars. And their Lord of Night.

Great Horned Headband.info_en: Headband worn by worshippers of stag specters
Great Horned Headband.caption_en:
Headband decorated by a pair of great horns.
Worn by ancestral follower warriors.

The ancestral followers keep their distance from the Erdtree, awaiting new buds. They are certain to sprout from their very flesh, and indeed, their souls.

Fur Raiment.info_en: Garb worn by worshippers of stag specters
Fur Raiment.caption_en:
Raiment fashioned from a bristly pelt.
Worn by ancestral follower warriors.

The ancestral followers keep their distance from the Erdtree, awaiting new buds. They are certain to sprout from their very flesh, and indeed, their souls.

Fur Leggings.info_en: Leggings worn by worshippers of stag specters
Fur Leggings.caption_en:
Leggings fashioned from bristly pelts.
Worn by ancestral follower warriors.

The ancestral followers keep their distance from the Erdtree, awaiting new buds. They are certain to sprout from their very flesh, and indeed, their souls.

Shining Horned Headband.caption_en:
Headband decorated by a pair of shining horns.
Worn by ancestral follower shamans.

Horns with buds that also shine are ideal ceremonial items for ancestral worship. Strengthens Ancestral Infant's Head.

Shaman Furs.caption_en:
Raiment fashioned from a bristly pelt.
Worn by ancestral follower shamans.

The ancestral followers live a distance from the Erdtree, awaiting new buds. They are certain to sprout from their very flesh, and indeed, their souls.

Shaman Leggings.caption_en:
Leggings fashioned from bristly pelts.
Worn by ancestral follower shamans.

The ancestral followers live a distance from the Erdtree, awaiting new buds. They are certain to sprout from their very flesh, and indeed, their souls.

Duelist Helm.info_en: Bronze helm adorned with many snakes
Duelist Helm.caption_en:
Bronze helm decorated with innumerable snakes.
Worn by gladiators who were driven from the colosseum. The wearer becomes a slightly easier target for foes.

The snake is viewed as a traitor to the Erdtree, and the audience delighted in seeing these bronze effigies beaten and battered.

Gravekeeper Cloak.info_en: Robe made from a beast pelt
Gravekeeper Cloak.caption_en:
Thick, bristly cloak that is the symbol of an underground gravekeeper.

Those who once fought for a living were driven from the colosseum, and becoming guardians of Erdtree Burial.

Duelist Greaves.caption_en:
Greaves encircled by bronze snakes.
Worn by gladiators who were driven from the colosseum. The wearer becomes a slightly easier target for foes.

The snake is viewed as a traitor to the Erdtree, and the audience delighted in seeing these bronze effigies beaten and battered.

Gravekeeper Cloak (Altered).caption_en:
Defensive wear encircled by bronze snakes.
Worn by gladiators who were driven from the colosseum. The wearer becomes a slightly easier target for foes.

The snake is viewed as a traitor to the Erdtree, and the audience delighted in seeing these bronze effigies beaten and battered.

Sanguine Noble Hood.info_en: Hood of dyed black cloth featuring gold embroidery
Sanguine Noble Hood.caption_en:
Hood of dyed black cloth featuring gold embroidery.
Worn by the nobles who serve the Lord of Blood.

Known to strike from pools of blood, these assassins are missionaries come to share the gospel of accursed blood.

Sanguine Noble Robe.info_en: Robe of dyed black cloth featuring gold embroidery
Sanguine Noble Robe.caption_en:
Robe of dyed black cloth featuring gold embroidery.
Worn by the nobles who serve the Lord of Blood.

The grand metallic pattern on the shoulder is a signifier of the noble rank they intend to claim upon the advent of the new dynasty they are working to install.

Sanguine Noble Waistcloth.caption_en:
Waistcloth sewn from black cloth.
Worn by the nobles who serve the Lord of Blood.

Known to strike from pools of blood, these assassins are missionaries come to share the gospel of accursed blood.

Guardian Mask.info_en: Mask worn by the people of rotted abundance
Guardian Mask.caption_en:
Engraved golden mask.
Worn by the guardians of the Minor Erdtrees.

In accordance with an ancient pact with the Erdtree, it is said that their deaths led not to destruction, but instead to renewed, eternal life as guardians.

Guardian Garb (Full Bloom).info_en: Armor worn by the people of rotted abundance
Guardian Garb (Full Bloom).caption_en:
Engraved golden garb.
Worn by the guardians of the Minor Erdtrees.

Raises the HP recovery effects of the Flask of Crimson Tears, but greatly lowers fire damage negation.

It is said that the blood-red flowers blooming on their backs mark the senescence of their ancient pact. Perhaps the guardians are part tree already.

Guardian Bracers.info_en: Gauntlets worn by the people of rotted abundance
Guardian Bracers.caption_en:
Engraved golden bracers.
Worn by the guardians of the Minor Erdtrees.

In accordance with an ancient pact with the Erdtree, it is said that their deaths led not to destruction, but instead to renewed, eternal life as guardians.

Guardian Greaves.info_en: Greaves worn by the people of rotted abundance
Guardian Greaves.caption_en:
Engraved golden greaves.
Worn by the guardians of the Minor Erdtrees.

In accordance with an ancient pact with the Erdtree, it is said that their deaths led not to destruction, but instead to renewed, eternal life as guardians.

Guardian Garb.info_en: Vest worn by the people of rotted abundance
Guardian Garb.caption_en:
Engraved golden garb.
Worn by the guardians of the Minor Erdtrees.

In accordance with an ancient pact with the Erdtree, it is said that their deaths led not to destruction, but instead to renewed, eternal life as guardians.

Cleanrot Helm.info_en: Helm of a Wing Knight. Somewhat decayed...
Cleanrot Helm.caption_en:
Winged helm of the Cleanrot Knights, celebrated for their undefeated campaign in the Shattering.

The Cleanrot Knights vowed to fight alongside Malenia, despite the inevitable, if gradual, putrefaction of their flesh. Their acceptance of their fate made these battles the fiercest of all.

Cleanrot Armor.info_en: Armor of a Wing Knight. Somewhat decayed...
Cleanrot Armor.caption_en:
Armor of the Cleanrot Knights, celebrated for their undefeated campaign in the Shattering.

The Cleanrot Knights vowed to fight alongside Malenia, despite the inevitable, if gradual, putrefaction of their flesh. Their acceptance of their fate made these battles the fiercest of all.

The Cleanrot Knights vowed to fight alongside Malenia, despite the inevitable, if gradual, putrefaction of their flesh. Their acceptance of their fate made these battles the fiercest of all.

Cleanrot Helm (Altered).info_en: Light helm of a Wing Knight. Somewhat decayed…
Cleanrot Helm (Altered).caption_en:

The Cleanrot Knights vowed to fight alongside Malenia, despite the inevitable, if gradual, putrefaction of their flesh. Their acceptance of their fate made these battles the fiercest of all.

Cleanrot Armor (Altered).caption_en:

The Cleanrot Knights vowed to fight alongside Malenia, despite the inevitable, if gradual, putrefaction of their flesh. Their acceptance of their fate made these battles the fiercest of all.

Fire Monk Hood.info_en: Mail helm covering a headband engraved with flames
Fire Monk Hood.caption_en:
Mail hood of iron links covering a headband
engraved with flames. Attire of the Fire Monks.

The Fire Monks are guardians of the flame of ruin, forbidden by the Erdtree and said to be kept high in the Mountaintops of the Giants.

Fire Monk Armor.info_en: Fire Monk armor adorned with a red cloth
Fire Monk Armor.caption_en:
Black iron armor adorned with a red cloth.
Attire of the Fire Monks.

The grotesque face sculpted on the chest is said to depict the corrupt ancient god of the flame.
Taboos transform into lasting obsessions by virtue of the fear that they inspire.

Fire Monk Gauntlets.info_en: Fire Monk gauntlets which resemble flames
Fire Monk Gauntlets.caption_en:
Black iron gauntlets featuring a flame motif.
Attire of the Fire Monks.

The Fire Monks are guardians of the flame of ruin, forbidden by the Erdtree and said to be kept high in the Mountaintops of the Giants.

Fire Monk Greaves.info_en: Fire Monk greaves which resemble flames
Fire Monk Greaves.caption_en:
Black iron greaves featuring a flame motif.
Attire of the Fire Monks.

The Fire Monks are guardians of the flame of ruin, forbidden by the Erdtree and said to be kept high in the Mountaintops of the Giants.

Blackflame Monk Hood.info_en: Chain helm worn above a fire shaped crown
Blackflame Monk Hood.caption_en:
Mail hood of iron links covering a headband
engraved with flames. Attire of the Blackflame Monks.

The Blackflame Monks, enthralled by the god-slaying black flame, became traitors, abandoning their posts as guardians. The seduction of a taboo is never easily spurned.

Blackflame Monk Armor.info_en: Godskin Monk armor adorned with a white cloth
Blackflame Monk Armor.caption_en:
Black iron armor adorned with ashen cloth.
Attire of the Blackflame Monks.

The Blackflame Monks, enthralled by the god-slaying black flame, became traitors, abandoning their posts as guardians. The seduction of a taboo is never easily spurned.

Blackflame Monk Gauntlets.info_en: Godskin Monk gauntlets which resemble flames
Blackflame Monk Gauntlets.caption_en:
Black iron gauntlets featuring a flame motif.
Attire of the Blackflame Monks.

The Blackflame Monks, enthralled by the god-slaying black flame, became traitors, abandoning their posts as guardians. The seduction of a taboo is never easily spurned.

Blackflame Monk Greaves.info_en: Godskin Monk greaves which resemble flames
Blackflame Monk Greaves.caption_en:
Black iron greaves featuring a flame motif.
Attire of the Blackflame Monks.

The Blackflame Monks, enthralled by the god-slaying black flame, became traitors, abandoning their posts as guardians. The seduction of a taboo is never easily spurned.

Fire Prelate Helm.info_en: Fire Prelate helm sculpted in the image of a sage
Fire Prelate Helm.caption_en:
Helm engraved with a sacred countenance and housing a cauldron.
Attire of the Fire Prelates, commanders of the Fire Monks.

It is said the cauldron perched atop the head was originally furnished with embers, and would surge into flames when the wearer's faith reached its zenith. The fire of this cauldron has since died out, however.

Fire Prelate Armor.info_en: Fire Prelate armor adorned with a red cloth
Fire Prelate Armor.caption_en:
Black iron armor adorned with a red cloth.
Attire of the Fire Prelates, commanders of the Fire Monks.

The weighty frames of the Prelates symbolized the onus of their grave vows as guardians of the flame. "Etch this sight upon thine breast. Of my thunderous gravity."

Fire Prelate Gauntlets.info_en: Fire Prelate gauntlets which resemble flames
Fire Prelate Gauntlets.caption_en:
Black iron gauntlets with the appearance of flames.
Attire of the Fire Prelates, commanders of the Fire Monks.

The weighty frames of the Prelates symbolized the onus of their grave vows as guardians of the flame. "Etch this sight upon thine breast. Of my thunderous gravity."

Fire Prelate Greaves.info_en: Fire Prelate greaves which resemble flames
Fire Prelate Greaves.caption_en:
Black iron greaves with the appearance of flames.
Attire of the Fire Prelates, commanders of the Fire Monks.

The weighty frames of the Prelates symbolized the onus of their grave vows as guardians of the flame. "Etch this sight upon thine breast. Of my thunderous gravity."

Fire Prelate Armor (Altered).info_en: Fire Prelate armor adorned with a red cloth
Fire Prelate Armor (Altered).caption_en:
Black iron armor.
Attire of the Fire Prelates, commanders of the Fire Monks.

The weighty frames of the Prelates symbolized the onus of their grave vows as guardians of the flame. "Etch this sight upon thine breast. Of my thunderous gravity."

Aristocrat Headband.info_en: Aristocrat headband, decorated with fine goldwork
Aristocrat Headband.caption_en:
Valuable headband featuring fine goldwork.
Travel attire worn by nobles in the capital.

Abandoning their birthplace after the Shattering, these undead wanderers are the pitiful product of unending life.

Aristocrat Garb.info_en: Aristocrat garb featuring fine gold embroidery
Aristocrat Garb.caption_en:
High quality garb adorned with fine golden embroidery.
Travel attire worn by nobles in the capital. Terribly faded and tattered.

Abandoning their birthplace after the Shattering, these undead wanderers are the pitiful product of unending life.

Aristocrat Boots.info_en: Aristocrat boots, made of thick leather
Aristocrat Boots.caption_en:
Boots made from tanned leather.
Travel attire worn by nobles in the capital.

Abandoning their birthplace after the Shattering, these undead wanderers are the pitiful product of unending life.

Aristocrat Garb (Altered).info_en: Aristocrat garb, adorned with golden embroidery
Aristocrat Garb (Altered).caption_en:
High quality garb adorned with fine golden embroidery.
Travel attire worn by nobles in the capital. Terribly faded and tattered.

Abandoning their birthplace after the Shattering, these undead wanderers are the pitiful product of unending life.

Aristocrat Hat.info_en: Aristocrat hat, decorated with a marcescent feather
Aristocrat Hat.caption_en:
Leather hat decorated with a withered feather.
Travel attire worn by nobles in the capital, and the belonging of a family which claims a knight as an ancestor.

Abandoning their birthplace after the Shattering, these undead wanderers are the pitiful product of unending life.

Aristocrat Coat.info_en: Aristocrat coat featuring fine gold embroidery
Aristocrat Coat.caption_en:
Tanned leather coat adorned with fine gold embroidery.
Travel attire worn by nobles in the capital, and the belonging of a family which claims a knight as an ancestor.

Abandoning their birthplace after the Shattering, these undead wanderers are the pitiful product of unending life.

Old Aristocrat Cowl.info_en: Aristocrat hood, made from superior cloth
Old Aristocrat Cowl.caption_en:
Cowl made of soft cloth.
Travel attire worn by nobles in the capital. Garb favored by the aged.

Abandoning their birthplace after the Shattering, these undead wanderers are the pitiful product of unending life.

Old Aristocrat Gown.info_en: Aristocrat gown featuring fine gold embroidery
Old Aristocrat Gown.caption_en:
Gown of soft cloth adorned with fine gold embroidery.
Travel attire worn by nobles in the capital. Garb favored by the aged.

Abandoning their birthplace after the Shattering, these undead wanderers are the pitiful product of unending life.

Old Aristocrat Shoes.info_en: Aristocrat shoes made from sturdy leather
Old Aristocrat Shoes.caption_en:
Hard-wearing shoes made of leather.
Travel attire worn by nobles in the capital. Garb favored by the aged.

Abandoning their birthplace after the Shattering, these undead wanderers are the pitiful product of unending life.

Vulgar Militia Helm.caption_en:
Helm worn by lean, mean, and filthy militiamen.

The upward extension serves to create an appearance of larger size, however slightly.

Vulgar Militia Armor.caption_en:
Armor worn by lean, mean, and filthy militiamen.

Freshly-singed battlegrounds effusing with the stench of the dead. Forbidden lands that will be excised from the memory of history. This is where the vulgar militia serve, as untiring, unsung watchkeepers.

Vulgar Militia Gauntlets.caption_en:
Gauntlets worn by lean, mean, and filthy militiamen.

Freshly-singed battlegrounds effusing with the stench of the dead. Forbidden lands that will be excised from the memory of history. This is where the vulgar militia serve, as untiring, unsung watchkeepers.

Vulgar Militia Greaves.caption_en:
Greaves worn by lean, mean, and filthy militiamen.

Freshly-singed battlegrounds effusing with the stench of the dead. Forbidden lands that will be excised from the memory of history. This is where the vulgar militia serve, as untiring, unsung watchkeepers.

Sage Hood.info_en: Hood of a travelling musician gripped by death
Sage Hood.caption_en:
A burgundy pointed hood.
Attire of the wise sages who were deemed heretical.

Evidence that the wearer was driven from town.

Sage Robe.info_en: Robe of a travelling musician gripped by death
Sage Robe.caption_en:
Thick burgundy robe.
Attire of the wise sages who were deemed heretical.

Evidence that the wearer was driven from town.

Sage Trousers.info_en: Waistcloth of travelling musician gripped by death
Sage Trousers.caption_en:
Thick burgundy trousers.
Attire of the wise sages who were deemed heretical.

Evidence that the wearer was driven from town.

Pumpkin Helm.info_en: Oval helmet large enough to cover any head
Pumpkin Helm.caption_en:
An oval helm large enough to cover any head.
Very heavy and very hard.

Reduces damage from headshots and impacts.

The inside of the helm is pitch black, keeping the crazed warrior within from panicking.
Perhaps its rather roomy interior also helps alleviate feelings of pressure and claustrophobia.

Elden Lord Crown.info_en: Crown of Godfrey, the first Elden Lord
Elden Lord Crown.caption_en:
Crown of Godfrey, the first Elden Lord.

The age of the Erdtree began amongst conflict, when Godfrey was lord of the battlefield.

He led the War against the Giants. Faced the Storm Lord, alone. And then, there came a moment. When his last worthy enemy fell. And it was then, as the story is told, that the hue of Lord Godfrey's eyes faded.

Elden Lord Armor.info_en: Armor of Godfrey, the first Elden Lord
Elden Lord Armor.caption_en:
Armor of Godfrey, the first Elden Lord.

The age of the Erdtree began amongst conflict, when Godfrey was lord of the battlefield.

He led the War against the Giants. Faced the Storm Lord, alone. And then, there came a moment. When his last worthy enemy fell. And it was then, as the story is told, that the hue of Lord Godfrey's eyes faded.

Elden Lord Bracers.info_en: Gauntlets of Godfrey, the first Elden Lord
Elden Lord Bracers.caption_en:
Bracers of Godfrey, the first Elden Lord.

The age of the Erdtree began amongst conflict, when Godfrey was lord of the battlefield.

He led the War against the Giants. Faced the Storm Lord, alone. And then, there came a moment. When his last worthy enemy fell. And it was then, as the story is told, that the hue of Lord Godfrey's eyes faded.

Elden Lord Greaves.info_en: Greaves of Godfrey, the first Elden Lord
Elden Lord Greaves.caption_en:
Greaves of Godfrey, the first Elden Lord.

The age of the Erdtree began amongst conflict, when Godfrey was lord of the battlefield.

He led the War against the Giants. Faced the Storm Lord, alone. And then, there came a moment. When his last worthy enemy fell. And it was then, as the story is told, that the hue of Lord Godfrey's eyes faded.

Elden Lord Armor (Altered).info_en: Armor of Godfrey, the first Elden Lord
Elden Lord Armor (Altered).caption_en:
Armor of Godfrey, the first Elden Lord.

The age of the Erdtree began amongst conflict, when Godfrey was lord of the battlefield.

He led the War against the Giants. Faced the Storm Lord, alone. And then, there came a moment. When his last worthy enemy fell. And it was then, as the story is told, that the hue of Lord Godfrey's eyes faded.

Radahn's Redmane Helm.info_en: Helm of Radahn, God of War
Radahn's Redmane Helm.caption_en:
Helm of the golden lion, with flowing red hair.
Worn by General Radahn.

Radahn inherited the furious, flaming red hair of his father Radagon, and is fond of its heroic implications.

"I was born a champion's cub. Now I am the Lord of the Battlefield's lion."

Radahn's Lion Armor.info_en: Armor of Radahn, God of War
Radahn's Lion Armor.caption_en:
Armor depicting the golden lion.
Worn by General Radahn.

The golden lion is said to symbolize Godfrey, the first Elden Lord, and his beast regent, Serosh. From his youngest years, Radahn was naturally captivated by the Lord of the Battlefield.

Radahn's Gauntlets.info_en: Gauntlets of Radahn, God of War
Radahn's Gauntlets.caption_en:
Gauntlets depicting the golden lion.
Worn by General Radahn.

The golden lion is said to symbolize Godfrey, the first Elden Lord, and his beast regent, Serosh. From his youngest years, Radahn was naturally captivated by the Lord of the Battlefield.

Radahn's Greaves.info_en: Greaves of Radahn, God of War
Radahn's Greaves.caption_en:
Greaves depicting the golden lion.
Worn by General Radahn.

The golden lion is said to symbolize Godfrey, the first Elden Lord, and his beast regent, Serosh. From his youngest years, Radahn was naturally captivated by the Lord of the Battlefield.

Radahn's Lion Armor (Altered).info_en: Armor of Radahn, God of War
Radahn's Lion Armor (Altered).caption_en:
Armor depicting the golden lion.
Worn by General Radahn.

The golden lion is said to symbolize Godfrey, the first Elden Lord, and his beast regent, Serosh. From his youngest years, Radahn was naturally captivated by the Lord of the Battlefield.

Lord of Blood's Robe.info_en: Robe of Mohg, Lord of Blood
Lord of Blood's Robe.caption_en:
Attire of Mohg, Lord of Blood, embroidered with an extravagant gold emblem on black cloth.

The dress of a Luminary, the reigning lord and hierarch of the coming dynasty of Mohgwyn. Or perhaps, of a raving lunatic.

Lord of Blood's Robe (Altered).info_en: Gown of Mohg, Lord of Blood
Lord of Blood's Robe (Altered).caption_en:
Attire of Mohg, Lord of Blood, embroidered with an extravagant gold emblem on black cloth.

The dress of a Luminary, the reigning lord and hierarch of the coming dynasty of Mohgwyn. Or perhaps, of a raving lunatic.

Queen's Crescent Crown.info_en: Crown of Rennala, the Full Moon Witch
Queen's Crescent Crown.caption_en:
A tall crown depicting the moon.
Worn by Rennala, Queen of the Full Moon. Increases intelligence.

When Rennala, head of both the Academy of Raya Lucaria and the Carian royal family, lost her husband Radagon, her heart went along with him.

And then, those at the academy realized. That Rennala was no champion, after all.

Queen's Robe.caption_en:
Robe indicating the highest order of sorcerer.

Godskin Apostle Hood.info_en: Hood made from tanned Demigod skin
Godskin Apostle Hood.caption_en:
Hood made by sewing together patches of smooth skin.
Worn by the Godskin Apostles.

The apostles, once said to serve Destined Death, are wielders of the god-slaying black flame. But after their defeat by Maliketh, the Black Blade, the source of their power was sealed away.

Godskin Apostle Robe.info_en: Robe made from tanned Demigod skin
Godskin Apostle Robe.caption_en:

Godskin Noble Hood.info_en: Hood made from tanned corpulent Demigod skin
Godskin Noble Hood.caption_en:
Hood made by sewing together patches of smooth skin.
Subcutaneous fat makes it plump and soft.
Worn by Godskin Nobles.

Nobles are the most ancient apostles who are said to have assimilated inhuman physiology. Not unlike the crucible, the Erdtree in its primordial form.

Godskin Noble Robe.info_en: Robe made from tanned corpulent Demigod skin
Godskin Noble Robe.caption_en:
Robe made by sewing together patches of smooth skin.
Subcutaneous fat makes it plump and soft. Worn by Godskin Nobles, known for their seven-face aprons.

Strengthens the Noble Presence incantation.

Nobles are the most ancient apostles who are said to have assimilated inhuman physiology. Not unlike the crucible, the Erdtree in its primordial form.

Depraved Perfumer Headscarf.info_en: Hood of a depraved perfumer gripped by madness
Depraved Perfumer Headscarf.caption_en:
Headscarf worn by depraved perfumers.

These heresy-inclined perfumers imbibe their own spices to alter body and mind. Their slow descent into self-destruction is what earned them their name.

Depraved Perfumer Robe.info_en: Robe of a depraved perfumer gripped by madness
Depraved Perfumer Robe.caption_en:
Robe worn by depraved perfumers.
The embroidery on the apron is itself a curse upon the Erdtree.

These heresy-inclined perfumers imbibe their own spices to alter body and mind. Their slow descent into self-destruction is what earned them their name.

Crucible Axe Helm.info_en: Helm used by Ordovis of the Crucible and his men
Crucible Axe Helm.caption_en:
Helm of the Crucible Knights who served Godfrey, the first Elden Lord.

The axe ornamentation is the knight Ordovis's mark, displayed also by his men.

Holds the power of the crucible of life, the primordial form of the Erdtree. Strengthens Aspects of the Crucible incantations.

Crucible Axe Armor.info_en: Armor used by Ordovis of the Crucible and his men
Crucible Axe Armor.caption_en:
Armor of the Crucible Knights who served Godfrey, the first Elden Lord.

Worn by the knight Ordovis and his men.

Holds the power of the crucible of life, the primordial form of the Erdtree. Strengthens Aspects of the Crucible incantations.

Crucible Gauntlets.info_en: Gauntlets used by the Crucible Knights
Crucible Gauntlets.caption_en:
Gauntlets of the Crucible Knights who served Godfrey, the first Elden Lord.

Hold the power of the crucible of life, the primordial form of the Erdtree. Strengthen Aspects of the Crucible incantations.

In time, the strength shown by these knights, and even their appearance, was seen as chaotic and deserving of scorn.

Crucible Greaves.info_en: Greaves used by the Crucible Knights
Crucible Greaves.caption_en:

Holds the power of the crucible of life, the primordial form of the Erdtree. Strengthens Aspects of the Crucible incantations.

Lusat's Glintstone Crown.info_en: Skull-merged Crown of a Crystal Sorcerer
Lusat's Glintstone Crown.caption_en:
The giant blue glintstone crown worn by Lusat, primeval current sorcerer.

This crown replaced Lusat's brain and skull altogether, and now, removed from his body, it is all but dead. What power remains within raises the potency of Lusat's primeval current sorceries at the cost of additional FP consumption.

Lusat's Robe.info_en: Dull red robe of a Crystal Sorcerer
Lusat's Robe.caption_en:
A robe reserved for grand masters at the Academy of Raya Lucaria.
Corroded by blue glintstones.

Since the grand masters Azur and Lusat were driven from the academy, no one has achieved their formerly-held rank.

Lusat's Manchettes.info_en: Dull red  arm wraps of a Crystal Sorcerer
Lusat's Manchettes.caption_en:
Manchettes corroded by blue glintstones.
Worn by Lusat, primeval current sorcerer.

Lusat had reached a near-inorganic state.

Old Sorcerer's Legwraps.info_en: Dull red waistcloth of a Crystal Sorcerer
Old Sorcerer's Legwraps.caption_en:
Ragged waistcloth that extends to the thighs.
Common amongst old-fashioned sorcerers.

Azur's Glintstone Crown.info_en: Blue transparent crown of a Crystal Sorcerer
Azur's Glintstone Crown.caption_en:
Crown of Azur, primeval current sorcerer, set with a prominent blue-green glintstone.

This crown replaced Azur's brain and skull altogether, and now, removed from his body, it is all but dead. What power remains within raises the potency of Azur's primeval current sorceries at the cost of additional FP consumption.

Azur's Glintstone Robe.info_en: Blue transparent robe of a Crystal Sorcerer
Azur's Glintstone Robe.caption_en:
A robe reserved for grand masters at the Academy of Raya Lucaria.

Azur's Manchettes.info_en: Blue transparent arm wraps of a Crystal Sorcerer
Azur's Manchettes.caption_en:

Worn by Azur, primeval current sorcerer.

Azur had reached a near-inorganic state.

All-Knowing Helm.info_en: Helm of Gideon Ofnir, the All-Knowing
All-Knowing Helm.caption_en:
Helm set with countless eyes and ears.
Worn by Gideon Ofnir, the All-Knowing.

Knowledge begins with the recognition of one's ignorance. The realization that the search for knowledge is unending. But when Gideon glimpsed into the will of Queen Marika, he shuddered in fear.

At the end that should not be.

Twinned Helm.info_en: Helm worn by D, Knight of the Golden Order
Twinned Helm.caption_en:
Helm depicting entwined twins of gold and silver.

The two known as D are inseparable twins.
They are of two bodies and two minds, but one single soul. Not once do they stand together; not one word do they speak to one another.

Perhaps this armor longs to find its way to the other D.

Ragged Hat.caption_en: Helm pieced together from scavenged metal.

Ragged Armor.info_en: Armor pieced together from scavenged metal
