Ragged Armor (Altered).caption_en: Armor pieced together from scavenged metal.

Prophet Blindfold.caption_en:
Blindfold of exiled prophets who foretold misfortune—and were persecuted and driven from their homes as a result.

Why hesitate, if the path leading to the future is clear? Just close your eyes, and walk.

Corhyn's Robe.caption_en:
Robe of Corhyn the cleric.

Even after exile, Corhyn refused to recant his prophecies. And for this, he was blessed with the guidance of grace. 

Since then, the cart wheel draped on his neck has served as a reminder. That true guidance awaits those with iron wills. Those with unwavering faith.

Prophet Trousers.caption_en:
Trousers of exiled prophets who foretold misfortune—and were persecuted and driven from their homes as a result.

Made from rough fabric that scrapes against the skin like a sharpening file.

Prophet Robe (Altered).caption_en:
Robe of exiled prophets who foretold misfortune—and were persecuted and driven from their homes as a result.

Made from rough fabric that scrapes against the skin like a sharpening file.

Prophet Robe.caption_en:
Robe of exiled prophets who foretold misfortune—and were persecuted and driven from their homes as a result.

The shackles around the neck warn passersby not to lend an ear to their sermons.

Astrologer Hood.caption_en:
Hood fashioned from supple cloth.
Worn by those who look to the cosmos above.

They read fate in the stars, and are said to be heirs of the glintstone sorcerers.

But alas, the night sky no longer cradles fate.

Astrologer Robe.caption_en:
Robe fashioned from supple cloth.
Worn by those who look to the cosmos above.

They read fate in the stars, and are said to be heirs of the glintstone sorcerers.

But alas, the night sky no longer cradles fate.

Astrologer Gloves.caption_en:
Gloves fashioned from fine, supple cloth.
Worn by those who look to the cosmos above.

They read fate in the stars, and are said to be heirs of the glintstone sorcerers.

But alas, the night sky no longer cradles fate.

Astrologer Trousers.caption_en:
Trousers worn inside a robe.
Worn by those who look to the cosmos above.

They read fate in the stars, and are said to be heirs of the glintstone sorcerers.

But alas, the night sky no longer cradles fate.

Astrologer Robe (Altered).caption_en:
Robe fashioned from supple cloth.
Worn by those who look to the cosmos above.

They read fate in the stars, and are said to be heirs of the glintstone sorcerers.

But alas, the night sky no longer cradles fate.

Lionel's Helm.info_en: Oddly shaped helm used by foreign knights
Lionel's Helm.caption_en:
Round iron helm with a distinctive large brim.
Worn by Lionel the Lionhearted.

When this chivalrous, dauntless knight met Fia, who had been driven from her home, he declared himself to be her father.

Lionel's Armor.info_en: Oddly shaped armor used by foreign knights
Lionel's Armor.caption_en:
Round iron armor with a banner extending from its back.
Worn by Lionel the Lionhearted.

When this chivalrous, dauntless knight met Fia, who had been driven from her home, he declared himself to be her father.

Lionel's Gauntlets.info_en: Oddly shaped gauntlets used by foreign knights
Lionel's Gauntlets.caption_en:
Rounded iron gauntlets.
Worn by Lionel the Lionhearted.

When this chivalrous, dauntless knight met Fia, who had been driven from her home, he declared himself to be her father.

Lionel's Greaves.info_en: Oddly shaped greaves used by foreign knights
Lionel's Greaves.caption_en:
Rounded iron greaves.
Worn by Lionel the Lionhearted.

When this chivalrous, dauntless knight met Fia, who had been driven from her home, he declared himself her father.

Lionel's Armor (Altered).info_en: Oddly shaped armor used by foreign knights
Lionel's Armor (Altered).caption_en:
Round iron armor.
Worn by Lionel the Lionhearted.

When this chivalrous, dauntless knight met Fia, who had been driven from her home, he declared himself to be her father.

Hoslow's Helm.info_en: Heavy helm passed down through the Hoslow family
Hoslow's Helm.caption_en:
A twin-tailed silver helm decorated with flowery adornments. Symbol of the head of the revered House of Hoslow.

Juno Hoslow had a younger brother who was all talk and no trousers.

His inability to commit to action was such that Juno inherited the Hoslow legacy without resistance, granting him the freedom to shower his little brother with adoration.

Hoslow's Armor.info_en: Armor passed down through the Hoslow family
Hoslow's Armor.caption_en:
Garish silver armor decorated with red embellishments.
Passed down through the Hoslow family.

When Juno Hoslow received an invitation to the Volcano Manor, he discreetly refused.

"I have already walked many a road drenched in blood, yet never would I consider myself a champion."

Hoslow's Gauntlets.info_en: Gauntlets passed down through the Hoslow family
Hoslow's Gauntlets.caption_en:
Garish silver gauntlets decorated with red embellishments.
Passed down through the Hoslow family.

When Juno Hoslow received an invitation to the Volcano Manor, he discreetly refused.

"I have already walked many a road drenched in blood, yet never would I consider myself a champion."

Hoslow's Greaves.info_en: Greaves passed down through the Hoslow family
Hoslow's Greaves.caption_en:
Garish silver greaves decorated with red embellishments.
Passed down through the Hoslow family.

When Juno Hoslow received an invitation to the Volcano Manor, he discreetly refused.

"I have already walked many a road drenched in blood, yet never would I consider myself a champion."

Diallos's Mask.info_en: Helm passed down through the Hoslow family
Diallos's Mask.caption_en:
Replica of a twin-tailed silver helm with flowery adornments. Only, without the twin tails.

Diallos Hoslow had an older brother who was a stern, self-possessed man of few words. His achievements made him seem out of reach.

And so the younger aspired to be like the older. Yearning for the day that he would tell the tale of House Hoslow, in blood. Knowing full well that it would break his brother's heart.

Hoslow's Armor (Altered).info_en: Armor passed down through the Hoslow family
Hoslow's Armor (Altered).caption_en:
Garish silver armor decorated with red embellishments.
Passed down through the Hoslow family.

When Juno Hoslow received an invitation to the Volcano Manor, he discreetly refused.

"I have already walked many a road drenched in blood, yet never would I consider myself a champion."

Vagabond Knight Helm.caption_en:
Helm of a knight banished from their motherland.
Dirty and battered after enduring a lengthy vagabond journey.

The visor is broken and can no longer be lowered.

Metal armor is heavy, but also sturdy, offering significant damage negation.

Vagabond Knight Armor.caption_en:
Chest piece of a knight banished from their motherland.
Dirty and battered after enduring a lengthy vagabond journey.

The crest emblazoned on the front is worn and dingy, no longer able to evoke sentiment.

Metal armor is heavy, but also sturdy, offering significant damage negation.

Vagabond Knight Gauntlets.caption_en:
Gauntlets of a knight banished from their motherland.
Dirty and battered after enduring a lengthy vagabond journey.

Metal armor is heavy, but also sturdy, offering significant damage negation.

Vagabond Knight Greaves.caption_en:
Greaves of a knight banished from their motherland.
Dirty and battered after enduring a lengthy vagabond journey.

Metal armor is heavy, but also sturdy, offering significant damage negation.

Vagabond Knight Armor (Altered).info_en: Chest Piece of a banished knight
Vagabond Knight Armor (Altered).caption_en:
Chest piece of a knight banished from their motherland.
Dirty and battered after enduring a lengthy vagabond journey.

The crest emblazoned on the front is worn and dingy, no longer able to evoke sentiment.

Metal armor is heavy, but also sturdy, offering significant damage negation.

Blue Cloth Cowl.info_en: Cowl of a nomadic warrior, made of blue cloth
Blue Cloth Cowl.caption_en:
Cowl of a nomadic warrior.
The blue color of its fabric symbolizes brisk waters, as fluid and flowing as the sword in the hand of its wearer.

Just as still waters turn foul, stagnation leads to decay.
Warriors must remain ever drifting.

Blue Cloth Vest.info_en: Vest of a nomadic warrior, made of blue cloth
Blue Cloth Vest.caption_en:
Vest of a nomadic warrior.
The blue color of its fabric symbolizes brisk waters, as fluid and flowing as the sword in the hand of its wearer.

Just as still waters turn foul, stagnation leads to decay.
Warriors must remain ever drifting.

Warrior Gauntlets.caption_en:
Gauntlets of a nomadic warrior.
Crafted from sturdy leather.

Warrior Greaves.caption_en:
Greaves of a nomadic warrior.
Crafted from sturdy leather.

White Mask.info_en: Strange birch mask that hides one's expression
White Mask.caption_en:
Bloodstained, faintly grinning white mask.
Worn by war surgeons who were effectively mercy killers.

The Lord of Blood's curse enlivens the wearer when bloodletting occurs. Slightly raises attack power when there is blood loss nearby.

War Surgeon Gown.info_en: Old white tunic, stained with blood
War Surgeon Gown.caption_en:
Bloodstained white gown of the war surgeons who were effectively mercy killers.

Of the surgeons that were abducted by the Lord of Blood, none were able to tame the accursed blood.
None but Varré, that is; though he was an exception.

War Surgeon Gloves.info_en: Physician's gloves made from thick leather
War Surgeon Gloves.caption_en:
Bloodstained white gloves of the war surgeons who were effectively mercy killers.

Of the surgeons that were abducted by the Lord of Blood, none were able to tame the accursed blood.
None but Varré, that is; though he was an exception.

War Surgeon Trousers.info_en: Physician's trousers made from thick leather
War Surgeon Trousers.caption_en:
Bloodstained trousers of the war surgeons who were effectively mercy killers.

Of the surgeons that were abducted by the Lord of Blood, none were able to tame the accursed blood.
None but Varré, that is; though he was an exception.

War Surgeon Gown (Altered).info_en: Physician's vest made from thick leather
War Surgeon Gown (Altered).caption_en:
Bloodstained white gown of the war surgeons who were effectively mercy killers.

Of the surgeons that were abducted by the Lord of Blood, none were able to tame the accursed blood.
None but Varré, that is; though he was an exception.

Royal Remains Helm.info_en: Mask that mediates via body of famed ancestor
Royal Remains Helm.caption_en:
Helm graced with gold human bones.
Worn by the unspeaking adherent of Sir Gideon the All-Knowing.

Slowly replenishes HP when HP is reduced.

It is said that the bones belong to an ancient lord―the soulless king. The lord of the lost and desperate, who was known as Ensha.

Royal Remains Armor.info_en: Armor that mediates via body of famed ancestor
Royal Remains Armor.caption_en:
Armor graced with gold human bones.
Worn by the unspeaking adherent of Sir Gideon the All-Knowing.

Gauntlets graced with gold human bones.
Worn by the unspeaking adherent of Sir Gideon the All-Knowing.

Slowly replenishes HP when HP is reduced.

It is said that the bones belong to an ancient lord―the soulless king. The lord of the lost and desperate, who was known as Ensha.

Royal Remains Greaves.info_en: Greaves that mediate via body of famed ancestor
Royal Remains Greaves.caption_en:
Greaves graced with gold human bones.
Worn by the unspeaking adherent of Sir Gideon the All-Knowing.

Slowly replenishes HP when HP is reduced.

It is said that the bones belong to an ancient lord―the soulless king. The lord of the lost and desperate, who was known as Ensha.

Brave's Cord Circlet.info_en: Headband of a warrior of the frigid uplands
Brave's Cord Circlet.caption_en:
Warrior's headband of woven leather.
Garb worn by warriors of the frigid uplands.

The small flags, white cloths and sheaves of wheat
often found hung from these headbands are
prayers of farewell from the people of their home.
In bidding farewell to warriors departing on
a journey from which they aren't like to return,
this small act offers only meager relief.

Brave's Battlewear.info_en: Battlewear of a warrior of the frigid uplands
Brave's Battlewear.caption_en:
Battlewear fashioned from leather armor
adorned with a large sheet of cloth.
Garb worn by warriors of the frigid uplands.

The red cloth signifies participation in the
Long March long, long ago and this ceremonial
garb beseeches the favor of the Warrior King
who led them.

Brave's Bracer.info_en: Gauntlets of a warrior of the frigid uplands
Brave's Bracer.caption_en:
Gauntlets wrapped in thick leather.
Garb worn by warriors of the frigid uplands.

Has a fur lining which excels at keeping
the cold at bay.

Brave's Legwraps.info_en: Greaves of a warrior of the frigid uplands
Brave's Legwraps.caption_en:
Greaves wrapped in thick leather.
Garb worn by warriors of the frigid uplands.

Has a fur lining which excels at keeping
the cold at bay.

Brave's Leather Helm.info_en: Helm of a warrior of the frigid uplands
Brave's Leather Helm.caption_en:
Battlewear wrapped in thick leather.
Garb worn by warriors of the frigid uplands.

Brave's Battlewear (Altered).info_en: Battlewear of a warrior of the frigid uplands
Brave's Battlewear (Altered).caption_en:
Helm wrapped in thick leather.
Garb worn by warriors of the frigid uplands.

Beast Champion Helm.caption_en:
Silver helm engraved with tiny beasts.
Worn by Bernahl the Recusant.

The beasts, their eyes and ears covered, represent an oath: "See nothing, hear nothing, doubt nothing, and carry on, along the path set in stone."

Beast Champion Armor.caption_en:
Silver armor engraved with tiny beasts.
Worn by Bernahl the Recusant.

Beasts are drawn to champions, and to lords. And this armor befits a champion worthy of becoming a lord. And that is what Bernahl was.

Until his maiden threw herself into the fire.

Beast Champion Gauntlets.caption_en:
Silver gauntlets engraved with tiny beasts.
Worn by Bernahl the Recusant.

Beasts are drawn to champions, and to lords. And this armor befits a champion worthy of becoming a lord. And that is what Bernahl was.

Until his maiden threw herself into the fire.

Beast Champion Greaves.caption_en:
Silver greaves engraved with tiny beasts.
Worn by Bernahl the Recusant.

Beasts are drawn to champions, and to lords. And this armor befits a champion worthy of becoming a lord. And that is what Bernahl was.

Until his maiden threw herself into the fire.

Beast Champion Armor (Altered).caption_en:
Silver armor engraved with tiny beasts.
Worn by Bernahl the Recusant.

Beasts are drawn to champions, and to lords. And this armor befits a champion worthy of becoming a lord. And that is what Bernahl was.

Until his maiden threw herself into the fire.

Champion Headband.info_en: Headband reserved for the badlands' bravest
Champion Headband.caption_en:
Headband reserved for the badlands' bravest.
Proof that the wearer has slaughtered countless foes.

Following the example of their chieftain Hoarah Loux, the brave warriors of the badlands shun excess adornment.

Champion Pauldron.info_en: Pauldron reserved for the badlands' bravest
Champion Pauldron.caption_en:
Pauldron reserved for the badlands' bravest.
Proof that the wearer has slaughtered countless foes.

Following the example of their chieftain Hoarah Loux, the brave warriors of the badlands shun excess adornment.

Champion Bracers.info_en: Gauntlets reserved for the badlands' bravest
Champion Bracers.caption_en:
Bracers reserved for the badlands' bravest.
Proof that the wearer has slaughtered countless foes.

Following the example of their chieftain Hoarah Loux, the brave warriors of the badlands shun excess adornment.

Champion Gaiters.info_en: Gaiters formed only of leather straps
Champion Gaiters.caption_en:
Gaiters formed only with leather straps.
Common wear in the badlands.

Crimson Hood.caption_en:
A hooded cloak of vivid crimson.
Worn by expatriated royalty.
Increases vigor.

Such cloaks were gifted to those who departed on journeys without specific orders, to faraway lands from which they would never return. In other words, the gift of a cloak made it easier for undesirables to be on their way. 

Roderika never once saw the guidance of grace.

Noble's Traveling Garb.caption_en:
Traveling attire fashioned from metallic white silk thread. Worn by expatriated royalty.

A gift of such rare beauty, a royal wouldn't disgrace their illustrious heritage even if found dead, in a ditch, in the middle of nowhere, while wearing such splendid raiment.

Noble's Gloves.caption_en:
Gloves of plush leather.
Worn by expatriated royalty.

A gift of such rare beauty, a royal wouldn't disgrace their illustrious heritage even if found dead, in a ditch, in the middle of nowhere, while wearing such splendid raiment.

Noble's Trousers.caption_en:
White trousers of superior craftsmanship.
Worn by expatriated royalty.

A gift of such rare beauty, a royal wouldn't disgrace their illustrious heritage even if found dead, in a ditch, in the middle of nowhere, while wearing such splendid raiment.

Navy Hood.caption_en:
A hooded cloak of deep navy.
Worn by expatriated royalty.
Increases mind.

Such cloaks were gifted to those who departed on missions to faraway lands, from which they would never return. But what choice did they have, having seen the guidance of grace?

Maliketh's Helm.info_en: Helm of Maliketh the Black Blade
Maliketh's Helm.caption_en:
Beast's helm made of black iron and decorated with gold.
Worn by Maliketh the Black Blade.

Maliketh, Queen Marika's loyal half-brother, bore a blade imbued with Destined Death, and there was not one demigod who did not fear him.

Champions knew what was at stake.
Indeed, that is what made them champions.

Maliketh's Armor.info_en: Armor of Maliketh the Black Blade
Maliketh's Armor.caption_en:
Beast's armor made of black iron and decorated with gold.
Worn by Maliketh the Black Blade.

Maliketh, Queen Marika's loyal half-brother, bore a blade imbued with Destined Death, and there was not one demigod who did not fear him.

Champions knew what was at stake.
Indeed, that is what made them champions.

Maliketh's Gauntlets.info_en: Gauntlets of Maliketh the Black Blade
Maliketh's Gauntlets.caption_en:
Beast's gauntlets made of black iron and decorated with gold.
Worn by Maliketh the Black Blade.

Maliketh, Queen Marika's loyal half-brother, bore a blade imbued with Destined Death, and there was not one demigod who did not fear him.

Champions knew what was at stake.
Indeed, that is what made them champions.

Maliketh's Greaves.info_en: Greaves of Maliketh the Black Blade
Maliketh's Greaves.caption_en:
Beast's greaves made of black iron and decorated with gold.
Worn by Maliketh the Black Blade.

Maliketh, Queen Marika's loyal half-brother, bore a blade imbued with Destined Death, and there was not one demigod who did not fear him.

Champions knew what was at stake.
Indeed, that is what made them champions.

Maliketh's Armor (Altered).info_en: Armor of Maliketh the Black Blade
Maliketh's Armor (Altered).caption_en:
Beast's armor made of black iron and decorated with gold.
Worn by Maliketh the Black Blade.

Maliketh, Queen Marika's loyal half-brother, bore a blade imbued with Destined Death, and there was not one demigod who did not fear him.

Champions knew what was at stake.
Indeed, that is what made them champions.

Malenia's Winged Helm.caption_en:
Winged helm made of unalloyed gold.
Worn by Malenia, Blade of Miquella.

Malenia awaited Miquella at the foot of the husk.

"My brother will keep his promise. He possesses the wisdom, the allure, of a god—he is the most fearsome Empyrean of all."

Malenia's Armor.caption_en:
Armor made of unalloyed gold.
Worn by Malenia, Blade of Miquella.

Malenia awaited Miquella at the foot of the husk.

"My brother will keep his promise. He possesses the wisdom, the allure, of a god—he is the most fearsome Empyrean of all."

Malenia's Gauntlet.caption_en:
Gauntlet made of unalloyed gold.
Worn by Malenia, Blade of Miquella.

Malenia awaited Miquella at the foot of the husk.

"My brother will keep his promise. He possesses the wisdom, the allure, of a god—he is the most fearsome Empyrean of all."

Malenia's Greaves.caption_en:
Greaves made of unalloyed gold.
Worn by Malenia, Blade of Miquella.

Malenia awaited Miquella at the foot of the husk.

"My brother will keep his promise. He possesses the wisdom, the allure, of a god—he is the most fearsome Empyrean of all."

Malenia's Armor (Altered).caption_en:
Armor made of unalloyed gold.
Worn by Malenia, Blade of Miquella.

Malenia awaited Miquella at the foot of the husk.

"My brother will keep his promise. He possesses the wisdom, the allure, of a god—he is the most fearsome Empyrean of all."

Veteran's Helm.caption_en:
An old helm that has seen many battles.
Worn by Niall, the veteran general of Sol.

Niall was a lone survivor who commanded spirits to defend his long-passed master.

This aging general could not die, nor did he have anywhere to fade away.

Veteran's Armor.caption_en:
Old armor that has seen many battles.
Worn by Niall, the veteran general of Sol.

Niall was a lone survivor who commanded spirits to defend his long-passed master.

This aging general could not die, nor did he have anywhere to fade away.

Veteran's Gauntlets.caption_en:
Old gauntlets that have seen many battles.
Worn by Niall, the veteran general of Sol.

Niall was a lone survivor who commanded spirits to defend his long-passed master.

This aging general could not die, nor did he have anywhere to fade away.

Veteran's Greaves.caption_en:
Old greaves that have seen many battles.
Worn by Niall, the veteran general of Sol.

Niall was a lone survivor who commanded spirits to defend his long-passed master.

This aging general could not die, nor did he have anywhere to fade away.

Veteran's Armor (Altered).caption_en:
Old armor that has seen many battles.
Worn by Niall, the veteran general of Sol.

Niall was a lone survivor who commanded spirits to defend his long-passed master.

This aging general could not die, nor did he have anywhere to fade away.

Bloodhound Knight Helm.info_en: Beast-like helm of the Bloodhound Knights
Bloodhound Knight Helm.caption_en:
Metal helm with a pointed beak.
Worn by the Bloodhound Knights.

The Bloodhound Knights are trained as hunters and known to be unshakable trackers.

Without the use of language, each knight chooses his own master.
Once the decision has been made, the knight stays loyal for life.

Bloodhound Knight Armor.info_en: Beast-like armor of the Bloodhound Knights
Bloodhound Knight Armor.caption_en:
Metal armor with a jutting breastplate.
Worn by the Bloodhound Knights.

The Bloodhound Knights are trained as hunters and known to be unshakable trackers.

Without the use of language, each knight chooses his own master.
Once the decision has been made, the knight stays loyal for life.

Bloodhound Knight Gauntlets.info_en: Beast-like gauntlets of the Bloodhound Knights
Bloodhound Knight Gauntlets.caption_en:
Metal gauntlets of the Bloodhound Knights.

The Bloodhound Knights are trained as hunters and known to be unshakable trackers.

Without the use of language, each knight chooses his own master.
Once the decision has been made, the knight stays loyal for life.

Bloodhound Knight Greaves.info_en: Beast-like greaves of the Bloodhound Knights
Bloodhound Knight Greaves.caption_en:
Metal greaves of the Bloodhound Knights.

The Bloodhound Knights are trained as hunters and known to be unshakable trackers.

Without the use of language, each knight chooses his own master.
Once the decision has been made, the knight stays loyal for life.

Bloodhound Knight Armor (Altered).info_en: Beast-like armor of the Bloodhound Knights
Bloodhound Knight Armor (Altered).caption_en:
Metal armor with a jutting breastplate.
Worn by the Bloodhound Knights.

The Bloodhound Knights are trained as hunters and known to be unshakable trackers.

Without the use of language, each knight chooses his own master.
Once the decision has been made, the knight stays loyal for life.

Festive Hood.info_en: Hood worn for a humble festival
Festive Hood.caption_en:
Hood worn by dancers at the festivities in Dominula, the village of windmills.

Decorated with many-colored flowers.

Festive Garb.info_en: Cloak worn for a humble festival
Festive Garb.caption_en:
Ceremonial garb worn by dancers at the festivities in Dominula, the village of windmills.

Faintly bloodstained.

Festive Hood (Altered).info_en: Wreath of flowers worn for a humble festival
Festive Hood (Altered).caption_en:
Hood worn by dancers at the festivities in Dominula, the village of windmills.

Decorated with a stunning array of flowers.

Festive Garb (Altered).info_en: Ceremonial garb worn for a humble festival
Festive Garb (Altered).caption_en:
Ceremonial garb worn by dancers at the festivities in Dominula, the village of windmills.

Faintly bloodstained.

Blue Festive Hood.info_en: Hood worn for a humble festival
Blue Festive Hood.caption_en:
Hood worn by dancers at the festivities in Dominula, the village of windmills.

Use of this hood, dyed in a stunning blue, is only permitted for the young maids who play the central role in the festival.

Blue Festive Garb.info_en: Cloak worn for a humble festival
Blue Festive Garb.caption_en:
Ceremonial garb worn by dancers at the festivities in Dominula, the village of windmills.

Use of this garb, dyed in a stunning blue, is only permitted for the young maids who play the central role in the festival.

Commoner's Headband.info_en: Hood of a rune cursed citizen
Commoner's Headband.caption_en:
A headband that holds cloth in place.
Standard wear for commoners of the Lands Between.

Only, there are no commoners remaining with their wits about them.

Commoner's Garb.info_en: Garb of a rune cursed citizen
Commoner's Garb.caption_en:
Garb with a thick embroidered cape attached.
Standard wear for commoners of the Lands Between.

The board hung from the neck depicts a sprawling tree, its roots and branches forming two holes. This is a self-imposed shackle, a voluntary display of allegiance to the Erdtree that increases faith.

Commoner's Shoes.info_en: Waistcloth of a rune cursed citizen
Commoner's Shoes.caption_en:
Modest shoes made of cloth.
Standard wear for commoners of the Lands Between.

Only, there are no commoners remaining with their wits about them.

Commoner's Headband (Altered).info_en: Garb of a rune cursed citizen
Commoner's Headband (Altered).caption_en:
A headband with the cloth removed.
Standard wear for commoners of the Lands Between.

Only, there are no commoners remaining with their wits about them.

Commoner's Garb (Altered).info_en: Garb of a rune cursed citizen
Commoner's Garb (Altered).caption_en:
Garb decorated with intricate embroidery.
Standard wear for commoners of the Lands Between.

The board hung from the neck depicts a sprawling tree, its roots and branches forming two holes. This is a self-imposed shackle, a voluntary display of allegiance to the Erdtree that increases faith.

Commoner's Simple Garb.info_en: Crown of a rune cursed citizen
Commoner's Simple Garb.caption_en:
Garb with a modest cloth cape attached.
Standard wear for commoners of the Lands Between.

The board hung from the neck depicts a sprawling tree, its roots and branches forming two holes. This is a self-imposed shackle, a voluntary display of allegiance to the Erdtree that increases faith.

Commoner's Simple Garb (Altered).info_en: Garb of a rune cursed citizen
Commoner's Simple Garb (Altered).caption_en:
Modest garb made of cloth.
Standard wear for commoners of the Lands Between.

The board hung from the neck depicts a sprawling tree, its roots and branches forming two holes. This is a self-imposed shackle, a voluntary display of allegiance to the Erdtree that increases faith.

Envoy Crown.caption_en:
The soft bundle worn on the head by Oracle Envoys.
Densely wrapped in several layers of cloth.

Raises the potency of bubble-based skills.

No one knows what the cloth hides, but some claim to have heard a faint whimpering from inside. It must have been their imagination.

Twinsage Glintstone Crown.info_en: Stone mask of the Twin Crystal Sage
Twinsage Glintstone Crown.caption_en:
One of the glintstone crowns bestowed upon Raya Lucaria scholars whose pursuits were deemed worthy.

Greatly increases intelligence to the detriment of HP and stamina.

Scholars of the Twinsage Conspectus were the elites of the academy, permitted to study and excel in sorceries of all kinds.

Raya Lucarian Robe.info_en: Robe worn by Raya Lucaria's magic scholars
Raya Lucarian Robe.caption_en:
Robe worn by Raya Lucaria's scholars of sorcery.

Those who dedicate themselves to the study of glintstones formed from starry amber receive this modest yet elegant deep navy garb after making their vows of virtue and austerity.

But with extended life, one is apt to forget old vows.

Sorcerer Manchettes.info_en: Manchettes worn by Raya Lucaria's magic scholars
Sorcerer Manchettes.caption_en:
Manchettes worn by Raya Lucaria's scholars of sorcery.
Made by wrapping a simple cloth around the forearms.

Sorcerer Leggings.info_en: Leggings worn by Raya Lucaria's magic scholars
Sorcerer Leggings.caption_en:
Leggings worn by Raya Lucaria's scholars of sorcery.
Made by wrapping a simple cloth around the legs.

Olivinus Glintstone Crown.info_en: Stone mask of a Gold Amber Sage
Olivinus Glintstone Crown.caption_en:
One of the glintstone crowns bestowed upon Raya Lucaria scholars whose pursuits were deemed worthy.

Increases intelligence to the detriment of HP.

The lineage of the Olivinus Conspectus began with the sorcerer Lusat, and its adherents continue his study of meteors.

Lazuli Glintstone Crown.info_en: Stone mask of a Red Glintstone Sage
Lazuli Glintstone Crown.caption_en:
One of the glintstone crowns bestowed upon Raya Lucaria scholars whose pursuits were deemed worthy.

Increases intelligence and dexterity to the detriment of HP.

Scholars of the Lazuli Conspectus study Carian sorceries—a heterodox pursuit that views the moon as equal to the stars.

Karolos Glintstone Crown.info_en: Stone mask depicting the wise Karolos
Karolos Glintstone Crown.caption_en:
One of the glintstone crowns bestowed upon Raya Lucaria scholars whose pursuits were deemed worthy.

Increases intelligence to the detriment of stamina.

The Karolos Conspectus is the oldest of the academy's lineages of study, begat by the sorcerer Azur. Scholars who follow in his footsteps pursue the mysteries of comets.

Witch's Glintstone Crown.info_en: Stone mask of a Green Glintstone Sage
Witch's Glintstone Crown.caption_en:
One of the glintstone crowns bestowed upon Raya Lucaria scholars whose pursuits were deemed worthy.

Increases intelligence and arcane to the detriment of stamina.

This gentle-looking crown was granted to a scholar who excelled in her studies, which also merited the title of "witch."

Marionette Soldier Helm.info_en: Cylindrical helm worn by marionette soldiers
Marionette Soldier Helm.caption_en:
Cylindrical helm of plate metal reinforced with a lattice.
Worn by marionette soldiers, crafted to serve the sorcerers.

The construction of this helm is remarkably crude.

For a doll, the only thing that matters is that it does not break.

Marionette Soldier Armor.info_en: Armor of lattice plate worn by marionette soldiers
Marionette Soldier Armor.caption_en:
Armor of metal bands arranged in a lattice.
Worn by marionette soldiers, crafted to serve the sorcerers.

The construction of this armor is remarkably crude, now rusted over and severely dented.

For a doll, the only thing that matters is that it does not break.

Marionette Soldier Birdhelm.info_en: Iron mask worn by marionette soldiers
Marionette Soldier Birdhelm.caption_en:
Metal helm formed in the likeness of the face of a bird.
Worn by avionette soldiers, crafted to serve the sorcerers.

The construction of this helm is remarkably crude.

For a doll, the only thing that matters is that it does not break.

Raging Wolf Helm.info_en: Helm of Vargram the Bloody Wolf
Raging Wolf Helm.caption_en:
Helm worn by Vargram the Raging Wolf, one of the first Tarnished to visit the Roundtable Hold.

Vargram's nickname comes from the white wolf's mane that decorates this helm.

Raging Wolf Armor.info_en: Armor of Vargram the Bloody Wolf
Raging Wolf Armor.caption_en:
Armor worn by Vargram the Raging Wolf, one of the first Tarnished to visit the Roundtable Hold.

According to the old legends, wolves are the shadows of the Empyrean, and this is what Vargram aspired to be.

Raging Wolf Gauntlets.info_en: Gauntlets of Vargram the Bloody Wolf
Raging Wolf Gauntlets.caption_en:
Gauntlets worn by Vargram the Raging Wolf, one of the first Tarnished to visit the Roundtable Hold.

According to the old legends, wolves are the shadows of the Empyrean, and this is what Vargram aspired to be.

Raging Wolf Greaves.info_en: Greaves of Vargram the Bloody Wolf
Raging Wolf Greaves.caption_en:
Greaves worn by Vargram the Raging Wolf, one of the first Tarnished to visit the Roundtable Hold.

According to the old legends, wolves are the shadows of the Empyrean, and this is what Vargram aspired to be.

Raging Wolf Armor (Altered).info_en: Breastplate of Vargram the Bloody Wolf
Raging Wolf Armor (Altered).caption_en:
Armor worn by Vargram the Raging Wolf, one of the first Tarnished to visit the Roundtable Hold.

According to the old legends, wolves are the shadows of the Empyrean, and this is what Vargram aspired to be.

Land of Reeds Helm.info_en: Helm of a warrior from the land of reeds
Land of Reeds Helm.caption_en:
Helm made from strips of iron fastened together.
Worn by warriors of the Land of Reeds.

The Land of Reeds has long been locked in a miserable civil war, during which time it has remained alienated from the cultures of its neighbors. Little wonder that the entire nation has succumbed to blood-soaked madness, or so it is said.

Land of Reeds Armor.info_en: Chest piece of a warrior from the land of reeds
Land of Reeds Armor.caption_en:
Armor made from strips of iron fastened together.
Worn by warriors of the Land of Reeds.

The grimy outer mantle is made from withered reeds from the warrior's birthplace.
Perhaps its comforts extend to nostalgic thoughts of home.

Land of Reeds Gauntlets.info_en: Gauntlets of a warrior from the land of reeds
Land of Reeds Gauntlets.caption_en:
Gauntlets wrapped in tough leather.
Worn by warriors of the Land of Reeds.

Land of Reeds Greaves.info_en: Greaves of a warrior from the land of reeds
Land of Reeds Greaves.caption_en:
Greaves wrapped in tough leather.
Worn by warriors of the Land of Reeds.

Land of Reeds Armor (Altered).info_en: Armor of a warrior from the land of reeds
Land of Reeds Armor (Altered).caption_en:
Armor made from strips of iron fastened together.
Worn by warriors of the Land of Reeds.

The Land of Reeds has long been locked in a miserable civil war, during which time it has remained alienated from the cultures of its neighbors. Little wonder that the entire nation has succumbed to blood-soaked madness, or so it is said.

Okina Mask.info_en: Mask adorned with a land of reeds veteran warrior
Okina Mask.caption_en:
A wooden mask that depicts an old man bearing his teeth. The source of the sobriquet of the great swordsman of the Land of Reeds.
Raises dexterity as it lowers focus.

The more he sharpened his mind, the more the absurdities of the world came into stark relief. And so Okina renounced it all, and rose to a higher plane. There was only himself. His katana. And its mastery.

Before long, Okina became a demon of a swordsman.

White Reed Armor.info_en: Stomach band of a land of reeds veteran warrior
White Reed Armor.caption_en:
Armor of the White Reeds, fashioned from banded iron plates.
Worn by the Inaba, head disciples of the great swordsman Okina.

The Inaba traveled in pursuit of not only the master who abandoned them, but also proper deaths, won honorably through hard-fought combat.
To be a White Reed is to seek death; fitting for the Inaba, who desired nothing more than to die by the sword.

White Reed Gauntlets.info_en: Gauntlets of a land of reeds veteran warrior
White Reed Gauntlets.caption_en:
Gauntlets of the White Reeds, fashioned from banded iron plates.
Worn by the Inaba, head disciples of the great swordsman Okina.

The Inaba traveled in pursuit of not only the master who abandoned them, but also proper deaths, won honorably through hard-fought combat.
To be a White Reed is to seek death; fitting for the Inaba, who desired nothing more than to die by the sword.

White Reed Greaves.info_en: Greaves of a land of reeds veteran warrior
White Reed Greaves.caption_en:
Greaves of the White Reeds, fashioned from banded iron plates.
Worn by the Inaba, head disciples of the great swordsman Okina.

The Inaba traveled in pursuit of not only the master who abandoned them, but also proper deaths, won honorably through hard-fought combat.
To be a White Reed is to seek death; fitting for the Inaba, who desired nothing more than to die by the sword.

Confessor Hood.info_en: Black hood of those who kill for a living
Confessor Hood.caption_en:
Black hood for blending in with the darkness.
Worn by church confessors.

The churches outside the Lands Between, dedicated to the teachings of the Two Fingers, send confessors out to follow the guidance of grace.

The confessors are loyal servants to the Two Fingers, ready to hunt down and quietly dispose of their enemies.

Confessor Armor.info_en: Black robe of those who kill for a living
Confessor Armor.caption_en:
Black leather armor for blending in with the darkness.
Worn by church confessors.

The churches outside the Lands Between, dedicated to the teachings of the Two Fingers, send confessors out to follow the guidance of grace.

The confessors are loyal servants to the Two Fingers, ready to hunt down and quietly dispose of their enemies.

Confessor Gloves.info_en: Gloves of those who kill for a living
Confessor Gloves.caption_en:
Black leather gloves of the church confessors.

The churches outside the Lands Between, dedicated to the teachings of the Two Fingers, send confessors out to follow the guidance of grace.

The confessors are loyal servants to the Two Fingers, ready to hunt down and quietly dispose of their enemies.

Confessor Boots.info_en: Boots of those who kill for a living
Confessor Boots.caption_en:
Leather boots of the church confessors.

The churches outside the Lands Between, dedicated to the teachings of the Two Fingers, send confessors out to follow the guidance of grace.

The confessors are loyal servants to the Two Fingers, ready to hunt down and quietly dispose of their enemies.

Confessor Hood (Altered).info_en: Mask of those who kill for a living
Confessor Hood (Altered).caption_en:
Cloth headwrap worn under a church confessor's black hood.
Such hoods are made for blending in with the darkness.

Confessor Armor (Altered).info_en: Vest of those who kill for a living
Confessor Armor (Altered).caption_en:
Black leather armor for blending in with the darkness.
Worn by church confessors.

The churches outside the Lands Between, dedicated to the teachings of the Two Fingers, send confessors out to follow the guidance of grace.

The confessors are loyal servants to the Two Fingers, ready to hunt down and quietly dispose of their enemies.

Prisoner Iron Mask.info_en: Iron mask worn by grave offenders
Prisoner Iron Mask.caption_en:
Iron mask forced on a prisoner convicted of an appalling crime.
Thick, heavy, and utterly stifling.

A foul creation designed to torment the wearer, either slowly fermenting hatred within their heart, or a spiritual fervor that is near indistinguishable from it.

Prisoner Clothing.caption_en:
Tattered clothing.
Worn by a prisoner convicted of an appalling crime.

Never once washed, every fiber is filthy.

Prisoner Trousers.caption_en:
Tattered trousers.
Worn by a prisoner convicted of an appalling crime.

Never once washed, every fiber is filthy.
The smell is beyond belief.

Blackguard's Iron Mask.info_en: Iron mask worn by only the most violent offenders
Blackguard's Iron Mask.caption_en:
Iron mask forced on convicted prisoners.
Worn by the blackguard Big Boggart.

To Boggart, the mask made him all the more threatening, and helped him get what he wanted. But it was also a mirror of his emptiness.

Traveling Maiden Hood.caption_en:
Hood worn by traveling maidens.

Maidens traversed the Lands Between for different reasons. Some to seek audience with the Fingers. Others, to find the Tarnished who they were destined to guide.

Traveling Maiden Robe.caption_en:
Robe worn by traveling maidens.

Maidens traversed the Lands Between for different reasons. Some to seek audience with the Fingers. Others, to find the Tarnished who they were destined to guide.

Traveling Maiden Gloves.caption_en:
Gloves worn by traveling maidens.

Maidens traversed the Lands Between for different reasons. Some to seek audience with the Fingers. Others, to find the Tarnished who they were destined to guide.

Traveling Maiden Boots.caption_en:
Boots worn by traveling maidens.

Maidens traversed the Lands Between for different reasons. Some to seek audience with the Fingers. Others, to find the Tarnished who they were destined to guide.

Traveling Maiden Robe (Altered).caption_en: Modest garb of traveling maidens, typically worn under their robes.

Finger Maiden Fillet.caption_en:
Fillet worn by maidens who serve the Two Fingers.

The maidens live to serve a chosen Tarnished, sharing their guidance and the wisdom of the Two Fingers.

The guidance of grace would ensure that the pair be brought together. Or at least, such was the promise long ago.

Finger Maiden Robe.caption_en:
Robe worn by maidens who serve the Two Fingers.

The maidens live to serve a chosen Tarnished, sharing their guidance and the wisdom of the Two Fingers.

The guidance of grace would ensure that the pair be brought together. Or at least, such was the promise long ago.

Finger Maiden Shoes.caption_en:
Shoes worn by maidens who serve the Two Fingers.

The maidens live to serve a chosen Tarnished, sharing their guidance and the wisdom of the Two Fingers.

The guidance of grace would ensure that the pair be brought together. Or at least, such was the promise long ago.

Finger Maiden Robe (Altered).caption_en:
Robe worn by maidens who serve the Two Fingers.

The maidens live to serve a chosen Tarnished, sharing their guidance and the wisdom of the Two Fingers.

The guidance of grace would ensure that the pair be brought together. Or at least, such was the promise long ago.

Preceptor's Big Hat.caption_en:
Large hat with the movements of the stars drawn on the inside of the brim.
Worn by the magic preceptors who served the Carian royals.

Increases mind to the detriment of stamina.

Glintstone sorcerers are the descendants of astrologers, a fact that the Carians remain aware of. Even if their fate has been long severed from the stars.

Preceptor's Long Gown.caption_en:
A long, bright blue gown with the movements of the stars drawn upon it.
Worn by the magic preceptors who served the Carian royals.

Glintstone sorcerers are the descendants of astrologers, a fact that the Carians remain aware of. Even if their fate has been long severed from the stars.

Preceptor's Gloves.caption_en:
Gloves of the magic preceptors who serve the Carian royals.
Black and perfectly discreet.

Preceptor's Trousers.caption_en:
Trousers of the magic preceptors who serve the Carian royals.
Black and perfectly discreet.

Mask of Confidence.caption_en:
Mask with the mouth sewn shut with gold thread.
Increases arcane.

When Radagon married Rennala, he ordered the Carian magic preceptors to don these masks. To make it clear that all of their matters were to be kept strictly private.

Preceptor's Long Gown (Altered).caption_en: Modest garb, previously worn under a long, bright blue gown with the movements of the stars drawn upon it.

Grass Hair Ornament.caption_en:
A headdress made from wildflowers.
Wearing this might make you less easy to spot.

Skeletal Mask.info_en: Hood worn by followers of the deadly birds
Skeletal Mask.caption_en:
Skeletal mask that tightly grips the face.
Worn by the assassins of Ravenmount.

This ritual implement relentlessly digs into the wearer's face, preserving one's human instincts while dressed in imitation of the Deathbirds.

Raptor's Black Feathers.info_en: Cloak worn by followers of the deadly birds
Raptor's Black Feathers.caption_en:
Robe crafted with the black feathers of a bird of prey.
Worn by the assassins of Ravenmount.

A ritual implement for transforming into a Deathbird, if only by imitation.
Strengthens jump attacks.

"We are birds of prey, bringers of death."

Bandit Manchettes.info_en: Wraps worn by followers of the deadly birds
Bandit Manchettes.caption_en:
Manchettes made by simply wrapping dirty cloth around the arms.
Worn by bandits.

Bandit Boots.info_en: Trousers worn by followers of the deadly birds
Bandit Boots.caption_en:
Leather boots worn by bandits.

Light for ease of movement, and supple for masking sound. In trade, they offer little damage negation.

Bandit Garb.info_en: Vest worn by followers of the deadly birds
Bandit Garb.caption_en:
Leather garb worn by bandits.

Light for ease of movement, and supple for masking sound. In trade, they offer little damage negation.

Eccentric's Hood.caption_en:
A pointy, ragged hood.
Worn by the knight Jerren.

The hood hides an aged, bearded mask.

Jerren served General Radahn as a guest commander, and they are said to have sworn an oath of honorable death to one another.

Eccentric's Armor.caption_en:
Unusually colorful armor.
Worn by the knight Jerren.

Jerren preferred a nomadic existence, but after spending time as a guest of the Carian royals, he became a guest commander for General Radahn.

And for the first time, the restless tumbleweed would be bound by honorable oath.

Eccentric's Manchettes.caption_en:
The knight Jerren's manchettes.

Jerren preferred a nomadic existence, but after spending time as a guest of the Carian royals, he became the guest commander for General Radahn.

And for the first time, the restless tumbleweed would be bound by honorable oath.

Eccentric's Breeches.caption_en:
The knight Jerren's breeches.

Jerren preferred a nomadic existence, but after spending time as a guest of the Carian royals, he became the guest commander for General Radahn.

And for the first time, the restless tumbleweed would be bound by honorable oath.

Eccentric's Hood (Altered).caption_en:
A pointy, ragged hood.
Worn by the knight Jerren.

The hood hides an aged, bearded mask.

Jerren served General Radahn as a guest commander, and they are said to have sworn an oath of honorable death to one another.

Fingerprint Helm.info_en: Deformed helm of a mad knight in despair
Fingerprint Helm.caption_en:
Iron helm singed and blistered by fingers.
Worn by Vyke, knight of the Roundtable Hold.

No other Tarnished was closer to the throne of the Elden Lord than Vyke. But without announcement, Vyke traveled far below the capital, and was scorched by the flame of frenzy.

Did he make his choice for his maiden, or did some other force lure him with suggestion?

Fingerprint Armor.info_en: Deformed armor of a mad knight in despair
Fingerprint Armor.caption_en:
Iron armor singed and blistered by fingers.
Worn by Vyke, knight of the Roundtable Hold.

No other Tarnished was closer to the throne of the Elden Lord than Vyke. But without announcement, Vyke traveled far below the capital, and was scorched by the flame of frenzy.

Did he make his choice for his maiden, or did some other force lure him with suggestion?

Fingerprint Gauntlets.info_en: Deformed gauntlets of a mad knight in despair
Fingerprint Gauntlets.caption_en:
Iron gauntlets singed and blistered by fingers.
Worn by Vyke, knight of the Roundtable Hold.

No other Tarnished was closer to the throne of the Elden Lord than Vyke. But without announcement, Vyke traveled far below the capital, and was scorched by the flame of frenzy.

Did he make his choice for his maiden, or did some other force lure him with suggestion?

Fingerprint Greaves.info_en: Deformed greaves of a mad knight in despair
Fingerprint Greaves.caption_en:
Iron greaves singed and blistered by fingers.
Worn by Vyke, knight of the Roundtable Hold.

No other Tarnished was closer to the throne of the Elden Lord than Vyke. But without announcement, Vyke traveled far below the capital, and was scorched by the flame of frenzy.

Did he make his choice for his maiden, or did some other force lure him with suggestion?

Fingerprint Armor (Altered).info_en: Deformed armor of a mad knight in despair
Fingerprint Armor (Altered).caption_en:
Iron armor singed and blistered by fingers.
Worn by Vyke, knight of the Roundtable Hold.

No other Tarnished was closer to the throne of the Elden Lord than Vyke. But without announcement, Vyke traveled far below the capital, and was scorched by the flame of frenzy.

Did he make his choice for his maiden, or did some other force lure him with suggestion?

Consort's Mask.info_en: White mask of Tanith, Lady of the Volcano Manor
Consort's Mask.caption_en:
Mask worn by Tanith, Lady of the Volcano Manor, in the image of a foreign queen.
Increases dexterity.

Long ago, when Rykard first set eyes on Tanith, she was working as a dancer in a foreign land. Soon, he made her his consort.
She was the only human to remain by his side when he became the serpent of blasphemy.

In that moment, Tanith was truly charmed by him.

Consort's Robe.info_en: Dress of Tanith, Lady of the Volcano Manor
Consort's Robe.caption_en:
Fine robe of white silk worn by Tanith, Lady of the Volcano Manor.

Long ago, when Rykard first set eyes on Tanith, she was working as a dancer in a foreign land. Soon, he made her his consort.
She was the only human to remain by his side when he became the serpent of blasphemy.

In that moment, Tanith was truly charmed by him.

Consort's Trousers.info_en: Skirt of Tanith, Lady of the Volcano Manor
Consort's Trousers.caption_en: Fine white trousers, perfectly suited for wearing beneath a silk robe.

Ruler's Mask.info_en: Stone mask of Rya, servant to the Volcano Manor
Ruler's Mask.caption_en:
Mask in the image of a wizened sage.
Customary dress among lords in a smaller nation.
Increases faith.

Such a mask illustrates the qualities of an ideal lord: chiefly, wise and possessing a certain defanged geniality.
One at the center of society often finds these qualities most expedient.

Ruler's Robe.caption_en:
Luxurious robe worn by lords in a smaller nation.
Its fine blue mantle serves to prove its wearer's status.

Upper-Class Robe.caption_en:
Embroidered, bright green robe worn by noble children.
Donning such a robe is traditionally the child's first show of burgeoning independence.

Marais Mask.info_en: An eerie white haired silver mask
Marais Mask.caption_en:
Mask in the image of a white-haired young noble.
Customarily worn by the head of House Marais.
Increases arcane.

The Marais family has a dual history spanning generations, serving as both executioners and castellans of the Shaded Castle. This mask bears the likeness of the first of their line.

Marais Robe.info_en: Noble's cape woven with sturdy fabric
Marais Robe.caption_en:
Robe with a black mantle across the shoulders.
Customarily worn by the head of House Marais.

The sons of House Marais are all sickly born.
Little wonder that Maleigh Marais would be so beguiled by the beautiful and fierce goddess who was born into rot.

Bloodsoaked Manchettes.info_en: Noble's waistcloth woven with sturdy fabric
Bloodsoaked Manchettes.caption_en:
Manchettes formed from tightly-wound bandages soaked through with blood.

Any protection is welcome for the festering arms beneath.

Bloodsoaked Mask.caption_en:
Mask formed from tightly-wound bandages soaked through with blood.

Even the most ghastly cover is more inviting than the festering face beneath.

Official's Attire.info_en: Noble's gown woven with sturdy fabric
Official's Attire.caption_en:
Grubby blue robe worn by magisterial officials to carry out their grim tasks.

Surveillance, executions, gruesome rituals… The darkest duties drive the wheels of mankind.

Omen Helm.info_en: Mask of a curse gnawed Omen
Omen Helm.caption_en:
Malformed helm resembling an Omen with its horns cut off.

Worn by the Dung Eater, its form is a vision of the landscape of his mind, and of his appearance as he wished to see it.

The heart of an Omen without the body to match; could there be any crueler existence?
What does it matter, then, if the curse claims it all?

Omen Armor.info_en: Armor of a curse gnawed Omen
Omen Armor.caption_en:
Malformed armor resembling an Omen with its horns cut off.

Worn by the Dung Eater.
The heavy, sun-shaped medallion represents both the guidance he once saw, and the ring to which it will one day lead.

Omen Gauntlets.info_en: Gauntlets of a curse gnawed Omen
Omen Gauntlets.caption_en:
Malformed gauntlets resembling an Omen with its horns cut off.

Worn by the Dung Eater, their form is a vision of the landscape of his mind, and of his appearance as he wished to see it.

The heart of an Omen without the body to match; could there be any crueler existence?
What does it matter, then, if the curse claims it all?

Omen Greaves.info_en: Greaves of a curse gnawed Omen
Omen Greaves.caption_en:
Malformed greaves resembling an Omen with its horns cut off.

Worn by the Dung Eater, their form is a vision of the landscape of his mind, and of his appearance as he wished to see it.

The heart of an Omen without the body to match; could there be any crueler existence?
What does it matter, then, if the curse claims it all?

Carian Knight Helm.caption_en:
Helm of the enchanted knights that once served the Carian royal family.

The enchanted knights, anointed by the Lunar Queen, were all heroes of the highest honors, but fell into disarray with the decline of the royal family.

Carian Knight Armor.caption_en:
Armor of the enchanted knights that once served the Carian royal family.

The enchanted knights, anointed by the Lunar Queen, were all heroes of the highest honors, but fell into disarray with the decline of the royal family.

Carian Knight Gauntlets.caption_en:
Gauntlets of the enchanted knights that once served the Carian royal family.

The enchanted knights, anointed by the Lunar Queen, were all heroes of the highest honors, but fell into disarray with the decline of the royal family.

Carian Knight Greaves.caption_en:
Greaves of the enchanted knights that once served the Carian royal family.

The enchanted knights, anointed by the Lunar Queen, were all heroes of the highest honors, but fell into disarray with the decline of the royal family.

Carian Knight Armor (Altered).caption_en:
Armor of the enchanted knights that once served the Carian royal family.

The enchanted knights, anointed by the Lunar Queen, were all heroes of the highest honors, but fell into disarray with the decline of the royal family.

Hierodas Glintstone Crown.info_en: Eyepatch worn by a great sorcerer turned hermit
Hierodas Glintstone Crown.caption_en:
One of the glintstone crowns bestowed upon Raya Lucaria scholars whose pursuits were deemed worthy.

Increases intelligence and endurance to the detriment of FP.

The crown of Hierodas was granted to scholars who engaged in nomadic study away from the academy.

Errant Sorcerer Robe.info_en: Cape worn by a great sorcerer turned hermit
Errant Sorcerer Robe.caption_en:
Commonplace robe made of thick cloth.
Worn by the Errant Sorcerer Wilhelm, one of the first Tarnished to visit Roundtable Hold.

A silent seeker of sorcery, who had gone so far as to make contact with the primeval current, Wilhelm was led by guidance into confrontation with his friend Vargram, and it is said that he was then taken prisoner in Roundtable Hold.

Errant Sorcerer Manchettes.info_en: Arm wraps worn by a great sorcerer turned hermit
Errant Sorcerer Manchettes.caption_en:
Commonplace leather manchettes.
Their hands are inlaid with dulled glintstone.

Errant Sorcerer Boots.info_en: Shoes worn by a great sorcerer turned hermit
Errant Sorcerer Boots.caption_en: Commonplace leather boots, sturdy enough to withstand a long journey.

Errant Sorcerer Robe (Altered).info_en: Tunic worn by a great sorcerer turned hermit
Errant Sorcerer Robe (Altered).caption_en:
Commonplace robe made of thick cloth.
Worn by the Errant Sorcerer Wilhelm, one of the first Tarnished to visit Roundtable Hold.

A silent seeker of sorcery, who had gone so far as to make contact with the primeval current, Wilhelm was led by guidance into confrontation with his friend Vargram, and it is said that he was then taken prisoner in Roundtable Hold.

Haima Glintstone Crown.info_en: Mask of an unaffiliated glintstone sorcerer
Haima Glintstone Crown.caption_en:
One of the glintstone crowns bestowed upon Raya Lucaria scholars whose pursuits were deemed worthy.

Increases intelligence and strength to the detriment of FP.

Scholars of the Haima Conspectus sought the power to quell conflict, and to this end studied the sorceries of cannon fire and the gavel.

Battlemage Robe.info_en: Robe of an unaffiliated glintstone sorcerer
Battlemage Robe.caption_en:
Robe worn by scholars of the Raya Lucaria Academy scholar, tattered from being worn on the battlefield.

Whenever war broke out and the academy sealed its gates, only Haima's scholars dared venture outside.
Seclusion is no way to foster discovery; it is only a convenient form of escape.

Battlemage Manchettes.info_en: Arm wraps of an unaffiliated glintstone sorcerer
Battlemage Manchettes.caption_en: Manchettes worn by scholars of the Raya Lucaria Academy, tattered from being worn on the battlefield.

Battlemage Legwraps.info_en: Waistcloth of an unaffiliated glintstone sorcerer
Battlemage Legwraps.caption_en: Legwraps worn by scholars of the Raya Lucaria Academy, tattered from being worn on the battlefield.

Snow Witch Hat.caption_en:
Witch's pointed hat, frigid and frozen through.
Of a style associated with practitioners of heretical sorcery.
Strengthens cold sorcery.

Once worn by the snowy crone who the young Ranni encountered deep in the woods. She was a witch, and well versed in cold sorceries.
It is said that the doll that houses Ranni's soul was modeled after her.

That old witch was Ranni's secret mentor.

Snow Witch Robe.caption_en:
Witch's robe in the color of snow.

Once worn by the snowy crone who the young Ranni encountered deep in the woods. She was a witch, and well versed in cold sorceries.
It is said that the doll that houses Ranni's soul was modeled after her.

That old witch was Ranni's secret mentor.

Snow Witch Skirt.caption_en:
Witch's skirt in the color of snow.

Once worn by the snowy crone who the young Ranni encountered deep in the woods. She was a witch, and well versed in cold sorceries.
It is said that the doll that houses Ranni's soul was modeled after her.

That old witch was Ranni's secret mentor.

Snow Witch Robe (Altered).caption_en:
Witch's robe in the color of snow.

Once worn by the snowy crone who the young Ranni encountered deep in the woods. She was a witch, and well versed in cold sorceries.
It is said that the doll that houses Ranni's soul was modeled after her.

That old witch was Ranni's secret mentor.

Traveler's Clothes.caption_en:
Light yet sturdy clothes.

Worn by young women who set off into the world to confront their fate.

Traveler's Manchettes.caption_en:
Light yet sturdy leather manchettes.

Worn by young women who set off into the world to confront their fate.

Traveler's Boots.caption_en:
Light yet sturdy leather boots.

Worn by young women who set off into the world to confront their fate.

Juvenile Scholar Cap.info_en: Cap worn by students of the Raya Lucaria Academy
Juvenile Scholar Cap.caption_en:
Cap worn by young academy scholars, the juveniles birthed anew by the amber egg of Queen Rennala, the head of Raya Lucaria Academy.

Yet their rebirth is not without imperfections, and thus do they repeat the process, eventually becoming utterly dependent upon it.

Rebirth is as sleep to them, and with each awakening, memory fades into oblivion.

Juvenile Scholar Robe.info_en: Robe worn by students of the Raya Lucaria Academy
Juvenile Scholar Robe.caption_en:
Robe worn by young academy scholars, the juveniles birthed anew by the amber egg of Queen Rennala, the head of Raya Lucaria Academy.

Yet their rebirth is not without imperfections, and thus do they repeat the process, eventually becoming utterly dependent upon it.

Rebirth is as sleep to them, and with each awakening, memory fades into oblivion.

Radiant Gold Mask.info_en: Mask worn by researchers of the Golden Order
Radiant Gold Mask.caption_en:
A mask designed to resemble a blazing golden halo.
Created and left behind by Lord Goldmask, a staunch pursuer of Golden Order fundamentalism.

Strengthens Golden Order incantations.

Its striking design represents both the brilliant inspiration that once shone upon him, and the vision of a ring that he will surely find at the end of his pursuit.

"To you who seek to shine as I do, wear it well!"

Goldmask's Rags.info_en: Robe worn by researchers of the Golden Order
Goldmask's Rags.caption_en:
Worn rags that just barely cover the body.

Lord Goldmask felt no draw to the vain excesses of clothing; what use is finery to one who seeks greater brilliance?

Gold Bracelets.info_en: Arm wraps worn by researchers of the Golden Order
Gold Bracelets.caption_en:
Bracelets made in the image of Erdtree branches.
Minimal adornments made by Lord Goldmask's disciples.

Those disciples have long since left him.

Gold Waistwrap.info_en: Waistcloth worn by researchers of the Golden Order
Gold Waistwrap.caption_en:
Waistwrap made in the image of Erdtree branches.
A minimal adornment made by Lord Goldmask's disciples.

Those disciples have long since left him.

Fell Omen Cloak.info_en: Robe worn by Morgott, the Elden Lord
Fell Omen Cloak.caption_en:
A cloak of ragged fur worn about the exposed body of Margit, the Fell Omen.

Having slaughtered countless champions during the Shattering, the Fell Omen has become a horror to those who harbor ambitions for the Erdtree, or for Lordship.

Albinauric Mask.info_en: Helm modeled after the silent Frog People
Albinauric Mask.caption_en:
Mask made from the largely unaltered hide of a young Albinauric.

Raises arcane, but reduces the HP recovery effects of the Flask of Crimson Tears.

A far cry from godskin, this Albinauric hide mask is the product of malicious mockery.

Dirty Chainmail.info_en: Chainmail worn by the silent Frog People
Dirty Chainmail.caption_en:
Chainmail worn by young Albinaurics.
The appearance of a protruding belly provides no benefits worthy of note.

Zamor Mask.info_en: Mask worn by an ancient hero
Zamor Mask.caption_en:
Mask worn by knights of Zamor, hailed as heroes in the War against the Giants.

These long-lived warriors, clad in biting, freezing winds, are said to have been the mortal enemies of the Fire Giants since time immemorial.

Zamor Armor.info_en: Armor worn by an ancient hero
Zamor Armor.caption_en:
Armor worn by knights of Zamor, hailed as heroes in the War against the Giants.

These long-lived warriors, clad in biting, freezing winds, are said to have been the mortal enemies of the Fire Giants since time immemorial.

Zamor Bracelets.info_en: Arm wraps worn by an ancient hero
Zamor Bracelets.caption_en:
Bracelets worn by knights of Zamor, hailed as heroes in the War against the Giants.

These long-lived warriors, clad in biting, freezing winds, are said to have been the mortal enemies of the Fire Giants since time immemorial.

Zamor Legwraps.info_en: Waistcloth worn by an ancient hero
Zamor Legwraps.caption_en:
Legwraps worn by knights of Zamor, hailed as heroes in the War against the Giants.

These long-lived warriors, clad in biting, freezing winds, are said to have been the mortal enemies of the Fire Giants since time immemorial.

Imp Head (Cat).info_en: Ancient mask with an animal motif
Imp Head (Cat).caption_en:
Head covering made from the largely unaltered head of an impish golem.

Resembling a cat, it holds trace amounts of feline intelligence.

Imp Head (Fanged).info_en: Ancient mask with an animal motif
Imp Head (Fanged).caption_en:
Head covering made from the largely unaltered head of an impish golem.

Resembling a fanged demon, it holds trace amounts of bestial strength.

Imp Head (Long-Tongued).info_en: Ancient mask with an animal motif
Imp Head (Long-Tongued).caption_en:
Head covering made from the largely unaltered head of an impish golem.

Resembling a long-tongued demon, it holds trace amounts of vexatious dexterity.

Imp Head (Corpse).info_en: Ancient mask with an animal motif
Imp Head (Corpse).caption_en:
Head covering made from the largely unaltered head of an impish golem.

Resembling the visage of a corpse, it holds trace amounts of lingering faith.

Imp Head (Wolf).info_en: Ancient mask with an animal motif
Imp Head (Wolf).caption_en:
Head covering made from the largely unaltered head of an impish golem.

Resembling a wolf, it holds trace amounts of lupine endurance.

Imp Head (Elder).info_en: Ancient mask with an animal motif
Imp Head (Elder).caption_en:
Head covering made from the largely unaltered head of an impish golem.

Resembling an elder, it holds trace amounts of arcane knowledge.

Silver Tear Mask.info_en: Head covering formed from silver tears
Silver Tear Mask.caption_en:
Mask fashioned from the corpse of a formless Silver Tear, supported by its hardened, shed husk.

Greatly increases arcane to the detriment of physical attack power.

To imitate the imitator is a cunning play indeed.

Chain Coif.caption_en:
Coif made of woven chain.
Standard issue for ordinary soldiers.

Though plain in appearance, it offers dependable protection.

Chain Armor.info_en: Chest piece made of woven chain
Chain Armor.caption_en:
Armor made of woven chain.
Standard issue for ordinary soldiers.

Though plain in appearance, it offers dependable protection.

Chain Gauntlets.caption_en:
Gauntlets made of woven chain.
Standard issue for ordinary soldiers.

Though plain in appearance, they offer dependable protection.

Chain Leggings.caption_en:
Leggings made of woven chain.
Standard issue for ordinary soldiers.

Though plain in appearance, they offer dependable protection.

Greathelm.caption_en:
Sturdy greathelm made from iron.

Though it is uncomfortably heavy and obstructs the vision of the wearer, it provides considerable damage negation.

Eye Surcoat.info_en: Iron armor with a surcoat attached
Eye Surcoat.caption_en:
Brown surcoat draped over chainmail.

The insignia emblazoned on the front marks out the wearer as the eyes and ears of Sir Gideon the All-Knowing.

Tree Surcoat.info_en: Iron armor with a blue surcoat attached
Tree Surcoat.caption_en:
Blue surcoat draped over chainmail.

The tree insignia emblazoned on the front depicts the Erdtree, and is a design beloved throughout the Lands Between.

Octopus Head.info_en: Helm modeled after a Land Octopus
Octopus Head.caption_en:
A land octopus whelp worn directly on the head.
Has a lingering warmth reminiscent of human skin.

Those who can withstand the smell will find its organic elasticity excellent for negating strikes.

Jar.info_en: This sturdy jar might serve well as a helm
Jar.caption_en:
Jar that fits cleanly over the head when upturned.
Made with pride by Iron Fist Alexander.

In a uniquely jarlike gesture of friendship, it boosts the power of throwing pot items.

Mushroom Head.info_en: Helm with slime mold growing on it
Mushroom Head.caption_en:
Mushrooms found growing all over the body.
These overgrown mushrooms have colonized the head.

To those enraptured by the scarlet rot, they are holy vestments that root one to the earth.

Mushroom Body.info_en: Armor with slime mold growing on it
Mushroom Body.caption_en:
Mushrooms found growing all over the body.
These overgrown mushrooms have colonized the torso.

To those enraptured by the scarlet rot, they are holy vestments that root one to the earth.

Mushroom Arms.info_en: Arm wraps with slime mold growing on them
Mushroom Arms.caption_en:
Mushrooms found growing all over the body.
These overgrown mushrooms have colonized the arms.

To those enraptured by the scarlet rot, they are holy vestments that root one to the earth.

Mushroom Legs.info_en: Leg wraps with slime mold growing on it
Mushroom Legs.caption_en:
Mushrooms found growing all over the body.
These overgrown mushrooms have colonized the legs.

To those enraptured by the scarlet rot, they are holy vestments that root one to the earth.

Nox Mirrorhelm.info_en: Shining helm decorated with a mirror
Nox Mirrorhelm.caption_en:
Helm fashioned from a crystal looking-glass.
One among the Eternal City's ritual implements.
Easily broken and weak against striking attacks.

Worn by those committed to high treason, it wards off the intervention of the Greater Will and its vassal Fingers.

Iji's Mirrorhelm.info_en: Shining helm decorated on all sides with mirrors
Iji's Mirrorhelm.caption_en:
Helm fashioned from a crystal looking-glass, said to have never left War Counselor Iji's head.
Easily broken and weak against striking attacks.

Worn by those committed to high treason, it wards off the intervention of the Greater Will and its vassal Fingers.

Iji was afraid. Terrified of his own treachery.

Black Hood.caption_en:
Hood of lusterless black fabric that conceals its wearer's identity.

In this world, there is very little that must necessarily be known.

Leather Armor.info_en: Dirty leather armor worn by bandits
Leather Armor.caption_en:
Lightweight and battle-proven leather armor worn by a savvy soldier.

Many admire the wearer of this armor for his chivalrous and forthright spirit.

Leather Gloves.caption_en:
Lightweight and battle-proven leather gloves worn by a savvy soldier.

Many admire the wearer of this armor for his chivalrous and forthright spirit.

Leather Boots.caption_en:
Lightweight and battle-proven leather boots worn by a savvy soldier.

Many admire the wearer of this armor for his chivalrous and forthright spirit.

Bandit Mask.caption_en:
Mask of black cloth that covers the mouth.

Favored by bandits for hiding their faces, it also provides some protection against poison.

Knight Helm.info_en: Iron helm worn by foreign knights
Knight Helm.caption_en:
Iron helm of an unknown knight.
It is made of thin iron plate.

Such metal armor is heavy, but provides considerable damage negation.

Knight Armor.info_en: Iron armor worn by foreign knights
Knight Armor.caption_en:
Iron armor of an unknown knight.
It is made of thin iron plate.

Such metal armor is heavy, but provides considerable damage negation.

Knight Gauntlets.info_en: Iron gauntlets worn by foreign knights
Knight Gauntlets.caption_en:
Iron gauntlets of an unknown knight.
It is made of thin iron plate.

Such metal armor is heavy, but provides considerable damage negation.

Knight Greaves.info_en: Iron greaves worn by foreign knights
Knight Greaves.caption_en:
Iron greaves of an unknown knight.
It is made of thin iron plate.

Such metal armor is heavy, but provides considerable damage negation.

Greathood.caption_en:
Hood far larger than the head it is meant to cover.
A burial shroud of sorts for those who discover, at long last, the truth they sought.

Increases intelligence and faith to the detriment of HP.

"Yes, surely this is the moon that young Rennala gazed upon."

Godrick Soldier Helm.caption_en:
Helm worn by soldiers loyal to Godrick the Grafted.
Made from durable iron, layered with a chainmail coif beneath.

Tree-and-Beast Surcoat.caption_en:
Armor worn by soldiers loyal to Godrick the Grafted.

The surcoat depicts the distant Erdtree and the beast regent, an emblem of the golden lineage.
Both are symbols of glory now past.

Godrick Soldier Gauntlets.caption_en:
Gauntlets worn by soldiers loyal to Godrick the Grafted.
Rust-worn and stained through unending conflict.

Godrick Soldier Greaves.caption_en:
Greaves worn by soldiers loyal to Godrick the Grafted.
Rust-worn and stained through unending conflict.

Raya Lucarian Helm.info_en: Helm used by Raya Lucaria Academy Knights
Raya Lucarian Helm.caption_en:
Helm worn by Raya Lucaria Academy soldiers.
Its brow is adorned with a single cuckoo's feather.

Cuckoo Surcoat.info_en: Armor used by Raya Lucaria Academy Knights
Cuckoo Surcoat.caption_en:
Armor worn by Raya Lucaria Academy soldiers.

The surcoat depicts twinned cuckoos peering into a flourishing mass of glintstone.
To a glintstone sorcerer, the body is a transient thing. The Cuckoo alone knows its insignificance, yet watches over it all the same.

Raya Lucarian Gauntlets.info_en: Gauntlets used by Raya Lucaria Academy Knights
Raya Lucarian Gauntlets.caption_en:
Gauntlets worn by Raya Lucaria Academy soldiers.
Rust-worn and stained through unending conflict.

Raya Lucarian Greaves.info_en: Greaves used by Raya Lucaria Academy Knights
Raya Lucarian Greaves.caption_en:
Greaves worn by Raya Lucaria Academy soldiers.
Rust-worn and stained through unending conflict.

Leyndell Soldier Helm.caption_en:
Helm worn by soldiers sworn to defend the royal capital of Leyndell.
Made from durable iron, layered with a chainmail coif beneath.

Erdtree Surcoat.caption_en:
Armor worn by soldiers sworn to defend the royal capital of Leyndell.

The surcoat bears a majestic likeness of the Erdtree. Its golden backing is an honor bestowed on no other soldiers.

Leyndell Soldier Gauntlets.caption_en:
Gauntlets worn by soldiers sworn to defend the royal capital of Leyndell.
Rust-worn and stained through unending conflict.

Leyndell Soldier Greaves.caption_en:
Greaves worn by soldiers sworn to defend the royal capital of Leyndell.
Rust-worn and stained through unending conflict.

Radahn Soldier Helm.info_en: Helm used by Caelid Wilds Knights
Radahn Soldier Helm.caption_en:
Helm worn by soldiers who fought by General Radahn's side.
Its visor is fashioned after a lion's fangs.

Redmane Surcoat.info_en: Armor used by Caelid Wilds Knights
Redmane Surcoat.caption_en:
Armor worn by soldiers who fought by General Radahn's side.

The surcoat depicts a red-maned lion raising a sword in the image of Radahn. Thus, they were Redmanes, and all proved they were worthy of the name.

Radahn Soldier Gauntlets.info_en: Gauntlets used by Caelid Wilds Knights
Radahn Soldier Gauntlets.caption_en:
Gauntlets worn by soldiers who fought by General Radahn's side.
Rust-worn and stained through unending conflict.

Radahn Soldier Greaves.info_en: Greaves used by Caelid Wilds Knights
Radahn Soldier Greaves.caption_en:
Greaves worn by soldiers who fought by General Radahn's side.
Rust-worn and stained through unending conflict.

Mausoleum Surcoat.caption_en:
Armor worn by headless soldiers who endlessly guard the Wandering Mausoleum.

The surcoat depicts the mausoleum bell, which rings in constant mourning for the soulless demigods.

Mausoleum Gauntlets.caption_en:
Gauntlets worn by headless soldiers who endlessly guard the Wandering Mausoleum.
Rust-worn and stained through unending conflict.

Mausoleum Greaves.caption_en:
Greaves worn by headless soldiers who endlessly guard the Wandering Mausoleum.
Rust-worn and stained through unending conflict.

Haligtree Helm.info_en: Helm used by Knights of Miquella
Haligtree Helm.caption_en:
Helm worn by soldiers sworn to the Haligtree.
An iron helm graced by a crown of unalloyed gold.

Increases faith.

Haligtree Crest Surcoat.info_en: Armor used by Knights of Miquella
Haligtree Crest Surcoat.caption_en:
Armor worn by soldiers sworn to the Haligtree.

The surcoat bears the crest of the Haligtree.
Though watered with Miquella's own blood since it was a sapling, the Haligtree ultimately failed to grow into an Erdtree.

Haligtree Gauntlets.info_en: Gauntlets used by Knights of Miquella
Haligtree Gauntlets.caption_en:
Gauntlets worn by soldiers sworn to the Haligtree.
Rust-worn and stained through unending conflict.

Haligtree Greaves.info_en: Greaves used by Knights of Miquella
Haligtree Greaves.caption_en:
Greaves worn by soldiers sworn to the Haligtree.
Rust-worn and stained through unending conflict.

Gelmir Knight Helm.caption_en:
Helm worn by knights once loyal to Praetor Rykard.
Its crest of red feathers symbolizes Rykard's pedigree as Lord Radagon's son.

Gelmir Knight Armor.caption_en:
Armor worn by knights once loyal to Praetor Rykard.

It bears an emblem that none wear any longer, standing as it does for a lord that fell from lofty ambition into gluttonous depravity.
As the lord lost his dignity, so too did these knights lose their master.

Gelmir Knight Gauntlets.caption_en:
Gauntlets worn by knights once loyal to Praetor Rykard.
Time has yet to dull their luster.

Gelmir Knight Greaves.caption_en:
Greaves worn by knights once loyal to Praetor Rykard.
Time has yet to dull their luster.

Gelmir Knight Armor (Altered).caption_en:
Armor worn by knights once loyal to Praetor Rykard.

It bears an emblem that none wear any longer, standing as it does for a lord that fell from lofty ambition into gluttonous depravity.
As the lord lost his dignity, so too did these knights lose their master.

Godrick Knight Helm.info_en: Helm used by Stormveil Elite Knights
Godrick Knight Helm.caption_en:
Helm worn by knights loyal to Godrick the Grafted.
Adorned with a plume of withered, ashen hair.

Godrick Knight Armor.info_en: Armor used by Stormveil Elite Knights
Godrick Knight Armor.caption_en:
Armor worn by knights loyal to Godrick the Grafted.

Its left breast is emblazoned with a two-headed war axe, an emblem of the golden lineage.
The knights surely boasted of their strength in days long gone.

Godrick Knight Gauntlets.info_en: Gauntlets used by Stormveil Elite Knights
Godrick Knight Gauntlets.caption_en:
Gauntlets worn by knights loyal to Godrick the Grafted.
Time has yet to dull their luster.

Godrick Knight Greaves.info_en: Greaves used by Stormveil Elite Knights
Godrick Knight Greaves.caption_en:
Greaves worn by knights loyal to Godrick the Grafted.
Time has yet to dull their luster.

Godrick Knight Armor (Altered).info_en: Armor used by Stormveil Elite Knights
Godrick Knight Armor (Altered).caption_en:
Armor worn by knights loyal to Godrick the Grafted.

Its left breast is emblazoned with a two-headed war axe, an emblem of the golden lineage.
The knights surely boasted of their strength in days long gone.

Cuckoo Knight Helm.info_en: Helm of Raya Lucaria Academy Elite Knights
Cuckoo Knight Helm.caption_en:
Helm worn by Raya Lucaria Academy knights.
Its brow is adorned with a single cuckoo's feather.

Cuckoo Knight Armor.info_en: Armor of Raya Lucaria Academy Elite Knights
Cuckoo Knight Armor.caption_en:
Armor worn by Raya Lucaria Academy knights.

Its left breast is emblazoned with a peering cuckoo, whence came their name.
Perhaps the bird's shrewd gaze is an expression of their refusal to be mere servants of the academy.

Cuckoo Knight Gauntlets.info_en: Gauntlets of Raya Lucaria Academy Elite Knights
Cuckoo Knight Gauntlets.caption_en:
Gauntlets worn by Raya Lucaria Academy knights.
Time has yet to dull their luster.

Cuckoo Knight Greaves.info_en: Greaves of Raya Lucaria Academy Elite Knights
Cuckoo Knight Greaves.caption_en:
Greaves worn by Raya Lucaria Academy knights.
Time has yet to dull their luster.

Cuckoo Knight Armor (Altered).info_en: Armor of Raya Lucaria Academy Elite Knights
Cuckoo Knight Armor (Altered).caption_en:
Armor worn by Raya Lucaria Academy knights.

Its left breast is emblazoned with a peering cuckoo, whence came their name.
